0.title: Puducherry girl eats rat poison after mistaking it for cake, dies
0.article_body: A 14-year-old girl died on Monday after she ate rat poison mistaking it for a chocolate cake in Karaikal of Puducherry, a report said. The girl, who was suffering from general dystonia (a movement disorder), complained of ill health and started vomiting after consuming the rat poison. She was later taken to a hospital, however, she died while undergoing treatment.

1.title: China-Russia relationship on the right track: Beijing
1.article_body: The relationship between Russia and China is "on the right track", senior Chinese diplomat Yang Jiechi told Russian envoy Andrey Denisov on Monday. Jiechi added, "[China is] willing to work with Russia to continuously implement the spirit of high-level strategic cooperation between the two countries...and promote the development of the international order in a more just and rational direction."

2.title: Illegal madrassa demolished in UP's Amethi
2.article_body: The district administration in Amethi demolished a madrassa constructed illegally on land meant for grazing animals. The administration also imposed a fine of ₹2.24 lakh on the owner of the madrassa. Earlier, the UP government had ordered a survey of unrecognised madrassas to gather information on the number of teachers, curriculum and their affiliation with any non-government organisations.

3.title: 'Brahmastra' sequel to go on floors by the end of 2022: Report
3.article_body: Ayan Mukerji's 'Brahmastra: Part two Dev' will reportedly go on floors by the end of 2022 or early 2023. "Ayan has more or less written the script for the entire Trilogy before he started shooting Part One," a source revealed. "Karan Johar and his co-producers Fox-Star are keen to kick-off Part 2 sooner rather than later," the source added.

4.title: Feet blisters won't stop us from uniting India: Rahul Gandhi
4.article_body: As Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' entered its third day in Kerala on Tuesday, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that feet blisters won't stop the party from uniting India. "India's dream is broken, not scattered. To realise that dream, we are bringing India together. 100 km done. And, we have just begun," Gandhi had said on Monday.

5.title: Father, son accidentally inhales LPG after gas leak in Vasai, saved
5.article_body: A man and his 10-year-old son accidentally inhaled liquified petroleum gas (LPG) after a gas leak in their laundry shop-cum-residence in Vasai on Saturday. Police took the help of locals and broke down the shop's shutters and found the man and his son lying unconscious. They were later taken to a nearby hospital and regained consciousness after a few hours.

6.title: 49 soldiers killed in border clashes with Azerbaijan: Armenia
6.article_body: Armenia said at least 49 of its troops were killed in clashes with Azerbaijan, the worst fighting between the countries since their 2020 war over the disputed Nagorno-Karabakh region. "The intensity of hostilities has decreased but attacks on one or two fronts from Azerbaijan continue," Armenian PM Nikol Pashinyan said. Russia and US have called both countries to observe restraint.

7.title: Video shows students made to study in portacabins in Delhi govt school
7.article_body: A video showing students made to study in makeshift portacabins in a government-run school in East Delhi was reported by ANI. For last few years, the Delhi government has been reportedly using portacabins for classrooms as construction of new buildings isn't completed or they haven't been handed over to institutions. The school's principal has reportedly refused to answer any questions.

8.title: 2 IEDs recovered from Maoist-hit Dantewada in Chhattisgarh
8.article_body: Two powerful improvised explosive devices (IEDs), suspected to have been planted by Maoists, were recovered by security forces in Chhattisgarh's Dantewada district on Monday. The explosives, weighing 10 kg each, were recovered by a CRPF team during a road security operation from beneath the earth, PTI reported. A bomb disposal squad later neutralised the explosives, an official said.

9.title: 3 kidnap 9-yr-old from Gurugram, demand ₹50 lakh ransom; held
9.article_body: Police on Saturday arrested three people for allegedly kidnapping a nine-year-old from Gurugram's Bhondsi and demanding ₹50 lakh as ransom. Police said that the suspects were friends of the victim's family and committed the crime over a financial dispute. The accused's husband had taken a loan from the victim's father and hatched the kidnapping plan to repay the amount.

10.title: 50 mn people in modern slavery amid COVID, conflicts and climate crisis: ILO
10.article_body: The International Labour Organization (ILO) has said the number of people forced into modern forms of slavery has risen to around 50 million in recent years. This involved people who "cannot refuse or cannot leave because of threats, violence, deception or abuse of power", ILO added. Armed conflicts, COVID-19 crisis and climate change worsened the situation.

11.title: Vedanta-Foxconn to make Atmanirbhar Silicon Valley a reality: Agarwal
11.article_body: Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal took to Twitter and said, "Vedanta's landmark investment of ₹1.54 lakh crore will help make India's Atmanirbhar Silicon Valley a reality." He also said the Vedanta-Foxconn joint venture will "reduce our electronics imports and provide 1 lakh direct skilled jobs to our people". Foxconn will be the technical partner, while Vedanta will finance the project.

12.title: Like Hanuman, you don't believe in your capacity: FM to India Inc
12.article_body: Referring to India Inc, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman asked what was preventing them from entering the manufacturing sector even as other countries are showing confidence in India. "Is it like Hanuman that you don't believe in your own capacity and strength," she asked, adding that the government was ready to hear the industry and act on what is presented.

13.title: 8-month-old baby dies in UP after mobile kept on charging near her explodes
13.article_body: An eight-month-old infant girl was killed after she suffered burn injuries when the battery of a mobile phone kept next to her for charging exploded in Uttar Pradesh. The mobile phone, reportedly belonging to Lava, was being charged through a solar panel. Her parents said that the phone was purchased nearly six months ago and its battery was swollen lately.

14.title: Cancer should be classified as notifiable disease: Parliamentary panel
14.article_body: The Parliamentary Standing Committee on Health and Family Welfare recommended that cancer be classified as a notifiable disease. The 139th report on "Cancer Care Plan and Management: Prevention, Diagnosis, Research and Affordability of Cancer Treatment" was submitted to RS Chairman. "Cancer still isn't classified as notifiable disease which results in underreporting of...deaths," report read.

15.title: Supply chain startup Procol raises ₹51 cr in Series A round
15.article_body: Supply chain startup Procol has raised ₹51 crore in its Series A equity financing round. The round saw participation from existing investors Blume Ventures, Beenext and Sequoia Surge, along with GMO VenturePartners, Alarko Ventures and angel investors Kunal Shah (CRED), Razorpay founders, Deb Deep Sengupta (SAP India), among others. Procol was founded in 2018 by Gaurav Baheti and Sumit Mendiratta.

16.title: Locals catch 'devil fish' amid floods in Hyderabad; video emerges
16.article_body: A suckermouth catfish, also known as devil fish, was recently found in floodwaters by residents of Hyderabad's Ramanthapur. A video showed a woman holding the fish in her bare hands while neighbours gathered around her to catch a glimpse of the creature. Meanwhile, the India Meteorological Department predicted that Hyderabad would receive light to moderate rain and thundershowers till Friday.

17.title: 47-yr-old man ends life over harassment from loan agents in Gurugram
17.article_body: A 47-year-old man allegedly died by suicide in Gurugram's Sector 7 after being harassed by three loan recovery agents, police said on Monday. According to police, the deceased's family members recovered a suicide note, that mentioned he was being harassed. "We've obtained call detail records of...three suspects. They'll be served notices to appear for questioning," a police official said.

18.title: Police officer, 1 other shot dead by man in Canada; 3 injured
18.article_body: A Toronto traffic police officer was shot dead along with another person in the Greater Toronto Area (GTA) of Canada's Ontario province on Monday by a man who was later neutralised by police, officials said. Three people were also injured in the shootings which spanned three locations in the GTA. No motive for the shooting has been revealed by police.

19.title: Vedanta, Foxconn to invest ₹1,54,000 cr in Guj for semiconductor plant
19.article_body: Vedanta and Taiwan's Foxconn have signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Gujarat government to invest ₹1,54,000 crore for setting up a display fabrication and semiconductor facility in the state. Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel said that the facility will create one lakh job opportunities. Foxconn is acting as the technical partner, while Vedanta will be financing the project.

20.title: Cong MLAs dump garlic at MP Assembly gate accusing govt of ignoring farmers
20.article_body: Congress MLAs dumped garlic at the MP Assembly gate on Tuesday, accusing the BJP-led government of not protecting farmers. "The state government is not purchasing garlic from farmers and this has resulted in a steep fall in the produce's price," said former Agriculture Minister Sachin Yadav. Farmers are unable to cover even the input cost of farming, he added.

21.title: Pune likely to witness rainfall till September 14
21.article_body: The India Meteorological Department has issued an orange alert in ghat regions in Pune and surrounding areas till September 14. Rainfall is likely to be moderate during this period in Pune. Heavy rains lashed Pune on Sunday, causing waterlogging and power cuts in several areas. Several instances of trees falling were also reported in the city.

22.title: Delhi Police Special Cell arrests man for attacking PCR vans in 2021
22.article_body: The Special Cell of Delhi Police on Tuesday arrested a man, Javed alias Jabid, for allegedly attacking four Police Control Room (PCR) patrolling vans in 2021. According to the police, the accused is a proclaimed offender and was absconding for over a year. He was involved in 15 heinous cases of crime in Delhi and Haryana, Delhi Police said.

23.title: They didn't do anything extraordinary: Dean Elgar on losing 3rd England Test
23.article_body: South Africa Test captain Dean Elgar has said England didn't do anything extraordinary in their nine-wicket win in three days in the final Test. "I thought they played the correct tempo...they were striking when they needed to strike," he stated. Elgar further said that the 11-day break after the second Test was something that "needs to be looked at".

24.title: 13-year-old killed, another injured as bus hits them in Telangana
24.article_body: A 13-year-old girl was killed and a boy injured on their way to school after getting hit by a bus in Telangana's Ibrahimpatnam town on Tuesday. The incident occurred when the driver was making a U-turn and failed to see the students, said police. While the driver is absconding, a case has been registered for causing death by negligence.

25.title: Journalist Siddique Kappan to remain in jail despite release order
25.article_body: Kerala-based journalist Siddique Kappan will continue to remain in jail as a case being probed by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) against him is still pending, prison department officials said. A Lucknow court on Monday issued Kappan's release order. Notably, Supreme Court recently granted bail to Kappan who was arrested by the UP government under the Unlawful Activities Prevention Act.

26.title: Kangana Ranaut thinks Dharma Productions is also under Centre: Kunal
26.article_body: Comedian Kunal Kamra took to Twitter and wrote that actress Kangana Ranaut thinks that Karan Johar's Dharma Productions is also under the central government. "Kangana thinks, like ED, NIA, CBI, Dharma Productions is also under central government," Kunal tweeted. This comes after Kangana accused Karan of manipulating box office numbers of Ranbir Kapoor-starrer 'Brahmastra'.

27.title: WB Police uses tear gas, water cannons to disperse protesting BJP workers
27.article_body: West Bengal Police used water cannons and tear gas to disperse BJP workers during their protest march to state Secretariat Nabanna in Kolkata on Tuesday. Buses on the way to Kolkata to participate in the march were stopped by police in North 24 Parganas. Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari, BJP MP Locket Chatterjee and party leader Rahul Sinha were detained.

28.title: Moving in right direction: Savita on 'Goalkeeper of the Year' award nomination
28.article_body: Indian women's hockey team goalkeeper Savita Punia said that being nominated for FIH women's 'Goalkeeper of the Year' award 2021-22 makes her feel that she's moving in the right direction in training. "The coaching staff and...players have been quite supportive. We've always worked together in every competition," she added. Savita had won the same award in the last edition.

29.title: Pune Collector reviews measures taken at road accident-prone areas
29.article_body: Pune District Collector Rajesh Deshmukh reviewed corrective measures taken at road accident-prone 'black spots'. Norms set up by the Centre describe a 'black spot' as an area of 500 metres of the road on which five or more accidents with deaths or serious injuries have taken place in three years. The review was done at district-level road safety committee meeting.

30.title: Pune banker attempts to rape his 19-year-old stepdaughter; booked
30.article_body: A 51-year-old banker has been booked on the charge of an attempt to rape his 19-year-old stepdaughter in Pune, officials said. The victim in her complaint said the accused tried to touch her inappropriately without her permission and tried to rape her on Sunday. "The medical examination of the girl has been done and the report is awaited," police said.

31.title: Russia detains man suspected of sending military aircraft pics to Ukraine
31.article_body: Russia has detained a top manager of an aviation factory on suspicion of passing secret military information to Ukraine, local news agencies reported, citing the Russian Federal Security Service (FSB). The man is suspected of taking pictures of equipment from Russian fighter planes and sending them to a Ukrainian national, who worked at an aviation plant in Ukraine, reports stated.

32.title: Stampede at stadium in Kenya ahead of presidential inauguration, many injured
32.article_body: People in Kenya's Nairobi forced their way into a stadium where William Ruto will be inaugurated as President. Police baton-charged people as they broke through barriers, causing stampede at Kasarani stadium. Report said 60 people have been injured and most of them have been rushed to the main hospital in Nairobi. Ruto narrowly won the election against Raila Odinga.

33.title: Rani attends Aditya's DDLJ Broadway show, poses with lead actors
33.article_body: Rani Mukerji watched her filmmaker-husband Aditya Chopra's 'Come Fall In Love', a Broadway musical based on 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge'. She also posed with lead actors Shoba Narayan, who plays Simran, and Austin Colby, who essays the role based on Shah Rukh Khan's Raj. "So thrilling to have you in...audience last night," Shoba wrote while sharing pictures with Rani.

34.title: Google faces $25.4 bn damages lawsuit over anti-competitive adtech practices
34.article_body: Google is facing a $25.4 billion damages claim lawsuit in the UK and EU over its alleged anti-competitive practices in the digital advertising industry. Publishers have long been harmed by Google's anti-competitive conduct, an official of one of the law firms involved in the suits said. UK's competition watchdog is also investigating Google's power in the digital advertising technology market.

35.title: In Bengal, Mamata is enforcing dictatorship similar to North Korea: BJP leader
35.article_body: Ahead of BJP's Nabanna march in West Bengal, BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari on Tuesday said that CM Mamata Banerjee does not have the support of her people so, "she is enforcing dictatorship similar to North Korea, in Bengal". Furthermore, he added, "Police will have to pay for what it's been doing since yesterday, BJP is coming."

36.title: Man strangles wife to death on suspicion of infidelity in Gurugram
36.article_body: A man was arrested after he allegedly thrashed his wife and then strangled her to death on the suspicion of infidelity in Gurugram, police said. The accused reportedly told his wife's father that she died by suicide, however, the latter didn't believe him and filed a complaint. "The accused was beating my daughter for...past one week," the wife's father claimed.

37.title: Congress worker shot dead in Himachal Pradesh's Una, probe on
37.article_body: A 40-year-old businessman and local Congress worker was shot dead by assailants near Punjab-Himachal border in Una district on Monday night. According to police, the victim, identified as Ravinder Kumar Sethi, and his nephew were walking near the Dulehar sports stadium when four men fired two shots at them. While Sethi was declared brought dead, his nephew suffered injuries.

38.title: Waterfalls appear at world's hottest place after massive flooding in US; video released
38.article_body: A video showing muddy waterfalls flowing down the mountainside in Death Valley National Park in US has been shared by park authorities. The waterfalls appeared after the area was hit by Hurricane Kay, leading to a flash flood. Death Valley National Park holds the world record for hottest temperature at 56.7°C and is also one of the world's driest places.

39.title: Mithila Palkar & Dhruv Sehgal announce audio season of 'Little Things'
39.article_body: Actress Mithila Palkar shared that the new season of 'Little Things' is an audio series. Talking about the show, titled 'Little Things: Jab Dhruv Met Kavya', Palkar said it's a "sweet, special story about how Dhruv and Kavya met". Actor-writer Dhruv Sehgal said 'Little Things' fans will find themselves listening to the series with "a goofy smile on their face".

40.title: Would've gone for Samson instead of Pant: Kaneria on India's T20 WC squad
40.article_body: Ex-Pakistan spinner Danish Kaneria said he would have picked Sanju Samson instead of Rishabh Pant in Team India's squad for T20 World Cup 2022. "It is...unfair for someone like Samson," added Kaneria. "India are repeating the same mistakes. Pant has been selected because he has an impressive record in Australia. However, his recent form hasn't been...great in T20s," he stated.

41.title: Hooda will need to play from 1st game as he's a 6th bowling option: Irfan
41.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Irfan Pathan has said India should play all-rounder Deepak Hooda from their first game in the upcoming T20 WC in Australia. "Hooda is a sixth bowling option, something that India struggled for in the last World Cup," stated Irfan. "There'll be a choice...between whether they want to play a left-hander in the middle order or Hooda," he added.

42.title: 22-year-old Mumbai student loses ₹96,000 to electricity bill fraud
42.article_body: A 22-year-old Mumbai student lost ₹96,000 to electricity bill fraud from his joint bank account with his mother. The victim got a text message saying his electricity bill payment date for August had expired, and if he didn't pay the bill, the power supply would be disconnected. Notably, the amount was meant for the cancer treatment of the victim's aunt.

43.title: Global firms looking to shift manufacturing operations from China to India: FM
43.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said global companies are looking to move out from China and set up their operations in India as they believe in India's growth story. Government will do everything to create an ecosystem for the industry to invest in India, Sitharaman added. Policies like PLI and tax cuts have been provided to India's private industry, she added.

44.title: BJP workers use boat to reach Bengal Secretariat during protest march
44.article_body: A group of BJP workers used a boat to cross the Tribeni river, Hooghly to reach West Bengal Secretariat Nabanna in Kolkata amid the party's protest march against the alleged corruption by CM Mamata Banerjee's TMC. Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari and several other BJP leaders were detained during the protest march. Adhikari was leading the march from Santragachi area.

45.title: PMC launches chatbot for citizens to get property tax-related info
45.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has launched a 24-hour WhatsApp Chatbot facility for citizens to get property tax-related information. Citizens would have to send a message on 8888251001 and select options to get respective information on matters including paid and due amount and tax bill. Additional Municipal Commissioner Ravindra Binwade said, "A total of nine services are included in it."

46.title: 18-yr-old boy found dead in residential building in Thane's Mira Road
46.article_body: An 18-year-old boy was reportedly found dead in a passageway on the second floor of a residential building in Thane's Mira Road on Sunday. According to family members, he had stepped out of his flat on the third floor on Saturday night for some work and didn't return, police said. A cleaning staff of the building found him lying dead.

47.title: Hoax bomb call triggers panic at The Leela Ambience Hotel in Gurugram
47.article_body: The Leela Ambience Hotel in Gurugram received a hoax bomb threat call on Tuesday, which triggered panic at the premises. An unidentified person called the hotel's reception desk around 11:55 am, following which the police and bomb squad reached the location. However, after a thorough investigation, it was found that it was a hoax call.

48.title: SPPU, Godrej introduce certificate course for disabled soldiers
48.article_body: In collaboration with Godrej company, the Savitribai Phule Pune University is introducing a course on 'Repair and Maintenance of Household Electronic Appliances' for the disabled soldiers of Queen Mary Technical Institute. The course will be conducted for the following three months. A team of experts from Godrej, along with university teachers, will guide the enrolled soldiers in the course.

49.title: BJP-ruled central govt not releasing funds for schemes: Bihar minister
49.article_body: Bihar Finance Minister Vijay Kumar Chaudhary has alleged that the BJP-ruled central government isn't releasing funds for various welfare schemes. He told PTI that due to this "all department heads have been advised to keep in check avoidable expenses". He added that central government is "playing politics over schemes" and that state government is struggling to get its "rightful dues".

50.title: Gelatin sticks installed at Pune's Chandani chowk to demolish old bridge
50.article_body: The authorities have installed 'gelatin sticks' in the pillars of the old bridge at Pune's Chandani chowk for its demolition. "The iron girders are being installed...to shift the service pipes over the bypass highway...work is in the final stage," an official said. "Work to start service roads towards Mulshi road and the Kothrud side is underway," the official added.

51.title: KRK says he lost 10 kg in 10 days, 'survived only on water' in jail; Twitter users react
51.article_body: Kamaal R Khan, who was recently released from jail, claimed that he "was surviving [on] only water for 10 days" in jail. "So I have lost 10 kg weight," he wrote in his tweet. Reacting to this, a Twitter user commented, "How is that even medically possible?" while another person jokingly wrote, "I want to lose weight...thanks for the idea."

52.title: Luxury brands cut ties with Chinese actor Li over repeatedly hiring prostitutes
52.article_body: Global brands including Prada and Remy Martin have cut ties with Chinese superstar Li Yifeng after he was arrested for repeatedly hiring prostitutes. The 35-year-old, also known as Evan Li, is hugely popular in China, with 60 million followers on the country's Twitter-like Sina Weibo platform. Li had played Communist leader Mao Zedong in a 2021 film.

53.title: Which Indian business schools are among world's top 100 in FT's ranking?
53.article_body: Seven Indian business schools are among the world's top 100 schools for masters in management programmes, as per Financial Times 2022 ranking. While IIM Bangalore ranked 31st in global list, SP Jain Institute of Management and Research ranked 44th. The list includes IIM Lucknow, IIM Udaipur, IIM Indore, NMIMS Mumbai, School of Business Management, and International Management Institute, New Delhi.

54.title: Video shows 18-wheel trailer overturning on car after sudden turn in Punjab; 3 killed
54.article_body: A CCTV footage shows an 18-wheel loaded trailer overturning after taking a sudden turn without slowing down and crushing a car under it in Punjab's Behram. Three family members including a couple and their son, who were travelling in the car, were killed. According to reports, three more people in another car that narrowly escaped the overturned trailer were injured.

55.title: Will be a globetrotting action adventure: Rajamouli on Mahesh Babu film
55.article_body: SS Rajamouli opened up about his next film with Mahesh Babu at the Toronto International Film Festival (TIFF). The director said the film will be "a globetrotting action adventure". "It's going to be a kind of James Bond or Indiana Jones film with Indian roots," he said. Mahesh is currently shooting for Trivikram Srinivas' next film, tentatively titled 'SSMB28'.

56.title: No music in Hyderabad pubs after 10 pm: Telangana High Court
56.article_body: The Telangana High Court has banned music or any other sound in Hyderabad pubs and bars between 10 pm and 6 am. The interim order came into effect on Monday. The court was replying to petitions regarding noise from pubs at night. The court also asked the Excise Department how pubs received licenses to operate near residential areas and schools.

57.title: Urvashi Rautela says 'I am sorry' to Rishabh Pant amid controversy, video surfaces
57.article_body: A video shared by 'Instant Bollywood' shows actress Urvashi Rautela saying "I am sorry" to Rishabh Pant amid the recent controversy. Earlier, in a viral interview, Urvashi had claimed that Pant wanted to meet her in Delhi. Pant had called it a "lie" and had urged her to leave him alone. Urvashi had later called Pant a "cougar hunter".

58.title: Doing an international project is on my wish list: Rasika Dugal
58.article_body: Rasika Dugal said she's interested in doing an international project, but she couldn't find time to work towards that dream. She said her commitments towards the subsequent seasons of her shows and some new offers kept her busy. "It's on my wish list and I'm putting it out there in the universe, hoping that it happens soon," she added.

59.title: Blue Origin's uncrewed rocket crash to face probe led by FAA
59.article_body: The FAA has announced that it will lead the investigation into the crash of Blue Origin's uncrewed rocket. It said that it will have to sign off before the firm's New Shepard vehicle can return to flight. The rocket crashed back to Earth just a minute after its launch on Monday, marking the first launch failure for the firm.

60.title: 15 JD(U) panchayat members in Daman and Diu join BJP
60.article_body: The BJP on Monday said that 15 out of 17 district panchayat members of JD(U) in Daman and Diu have joined the party. In a tweet, the party said that the members left JD(U) as Bihar CM Nitish Kumar joined hands with a 'bahubali', corrupt and dynasty-favouring party. Days ago, five Manipur JD(U) MLAs had joined the BJP.

61.title: So excited: Suhana Khan on Navya's 'What The Hell Navya' podcast
61.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's daughter Suhana Khan said she's "excited" about Navya Naveli Nanda's podcast 'What The Hell Navya'. Navya, the granddaughter of Amitabh Bachchan, announced the podcast on Monday. She said 'What The Hell Navya' will be a space where she'll "have fun conversations with some very special guests" and promised it'll be "raw, real, witty and deeply personal".

62.title: Mensa Brands acquires peanut butter brand MyFitness
62.article_body: Mensa Brands acquired peanut butter brand, MyFitness for an undisclosed amount. MyFitness was founded by Mohammad Patel and Rahil Virani in 2019 and has over 30 stock-keeping units with an average selling price of ₹500. Mensa was founded by Ananth Narayanan, former CEO of Myntra and Medlife. Accel Partners, Falcon Edge Capital and Tiger Global Management are among its investors.

63.title: HC judge's daughter gets bail in shooter Sippy Sidhu murder case
63.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court has granted bail to Kalyani Singh, a Himachal Pradesh High Court judge's daughter, who was arrested over the murder of national-level shooter Sippy Sidhu. A detailed order is awaited, one of Singh's lawyers said. The CBI had told a court that the murder, which took place in 2015, occurred after Singh and Sidhu's relationship soured.

64.title: Construction-tech firm 91Squarefeet raises $10 mn in Series A round
64.article_body: Construction-tech firm 91Squarefeet secured $10 million in a Series A funding round led by Stellaris Venture Partners. The round saw participation of existing investors like US-based Y Combinator, Hong Kong-based Betatron Venture Group and some angel investors. Gurugram-based company was founded by Amit Bansal, Puneet Bansal and Amit Mishra, who had co-founded a logistics-focused startup Quifers.

65.title: Osmania University girl students protest over quality of food at hostel
65.article_body: Girl students of Hyderabad's Osmania University staged a sit-in protest over the quality of food that was being served in the varsity hostel. Students staying in the Ladies Hostel Complex alleged that they found a broken bangle piece in the food. Despite paying ₹12,000-₹18,000 mess fee per annum, the hostel serves watery sambar and hard rice, a student said.

66.title: North Korea will self-destruct if it uses nuclear weapons: South Korea
66.article_body: South Korea on Tuesday warned North Korea that using its nuclear weapons would put it on a "path of self-destruction". This comes days after North Korea passed a new law allowing it to carry out a preemptive nuclear attack to protect itself. Pyongyang's new law would prompt Seoul and Washington to "further strengthen their...reaction capacities", South Korea's Defence Ministry said.

67.title: Ukrainian forces outnumbered Russian troops: Russia-installed official
67.article_body: A Russia-installed official in Ukraine's Kharkiv region, Vitaly Ganchev, said Ukrainian forces outnumbered Russian and pro-Russian forces by eight times during a counteroffensive. Ganchev told a state-owned television channel "the situation is becoming more difficult by the hour". On Sunday, Russian Defence Ministry published a map showing that its forces had abandoned the Kharkiv region.

68.title: If Rohit was half as fit as Kohli, he'd be the most destructive player: Salman
68.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Salman Butt has said Rohit Sharma would've been the "most destructive player" if his fitness levels were half as good as Virat Kohli's. Butt added that had Rohit been "very fit" like Kohli, then only AB de Villiers could be compared with him. "Rohit can't be compared with Babar and Rizwan," he further said.

69.title: India to host G20 summit in September 2023
69.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has confirmed that India will be hosting the G20 leaders' summit in New Delhi on September 9 and 10 in 2023. India will take over the presidency of G20 from Indonesia, which is set to host the leaders' summit in November this year. India is expected to host over 200 meetings across the country.

70.title: Papua New Guinea proclaims King Charles III as head of state
70.article_body: Papua New Guinea leaders held a ceremony to proclaim King Charles III as the country's new head of state and to acknowledge the passing away of Queen Elizabeth II. PM James Marape will meet the new King on Friday. Papua New Guinea is one of five countries in Asia and the Pacific where the British monarch is head of state.

71.title: UK unemployment rate falls to 48-year low as people quit labour market
71.article_body: Britain's unemployment rate fell to 3.6% in the May-July period as more people left the labour market, official figures showed. This is the lowest it has been since 1974. The number of people in employment grew by 40,000 in the three months, the Office for National Statistics said. The economic inactivity rate increased by 0.4 percentage points to 21.7%.

72.title: Parts of Kolkata witness waterlogging after heavy rainfall
72.article_body: Kolkata witnessed heavy rainfall on Tuesday, which led to waterlogging in several parts. Areas including Golf Green and Lake Gardens in the city were reportedly waterlogged. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicted the temperature to hover between 25 °C and 28 °C. Heavy rains were also witnessed in the southern region of West Bengal.

73.title: Feel lucky to be part of 'Uunchai': Anupam shares pics with Big B, Boman
73.article_body: Veteran actor Anupam Kher on Tuesday shared a series of pictures with 'Uunchai' director Sooraj Barjatya and co-stars Amitabh Bachchan and Boman Irani. The actor wrote in the caption, "I feel special and lucky to be part of this magnum opus directed by God's own child #SoorajBarjatya. Proud to be working with a great team of actors and technicians!"

74.title: Bombay HC dismisses Rabia's plea seeking reinvestigation of Jiah's case
74.article_body: Bombay High Court on Monday dismissed late actress Jiah Khan's mother Rabia's plea seeking a fresh investigation in the nine-year-old case. Jiah committed suicide on June 3, 2013 at her Mumbai residence. As per Rabia, Jiah was murdered. The case was probed by the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) which charged Jiah's boyfriend actor Sooraj Pancholi with abetting her suicide.

75.title: BJP keeps changing CMs, Cong is finished: Arvind Kejriwal in Gujarat
75.article_body: Ahead of the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections, Aam Aadmi Party chief Arvind Kejriwal, during his visit to the state, said that the Bharatiya Janata Party keeps changing Chief Ministers and the Indian National Congress is finished. "Let's stop taking questions about them," he told the media while talking about Congress. He also got into an argument with Gujarat Police.

76.title: King Charles, siblings hold silent vigil for Queen Elizabeth II
76.article_body: King Charles III and his siblings held a silent vigil at the side of their mother Queen Elizabeth II's coffin, which lay at rest in Edinburgh's historic cathedral on Monday. King Charles alongside his sister Princess Anne and brothers Prince Andrew and Prince Edward, stood solemnly for 10 minutes next to the coffin, draped with the royal flag.

77.title: BJP leaders Suvendu Adhikari, Locket Chatterjee detained during Nabanna march
77.article_body: BJP leaders, Suvendu Adhikari, Locket Chatterjee, Tapasi Mondal and Dibakar Gharami were detained during the Nabanna march in West Bengal. News agency ANI reported that the leaders were taken to Kolkata Police headquarters in Lalbazar. Meanwhile, Adhikari said that state Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee is enforcing a dictatorship like North Korea.

78.title: Jet Airways CEO shares pic of kid out of sunroof of car; asks 'Where have we failed?'
78.article_body: Jet Airways CEO Sanjiv Kapoor tweeted a picture and wrote, "Kid enjoying the breeze out of the sunroof as his car zips along [in] Gurugram. Where have we failed? In schooling, or parenting, or both?" Stating this can be a "good case study", Kapoor said, "While the majority see the danger, there are those that see nothing wrong in this."

79.title: AAP promises law for lawyers' protection if it comes to power in Gujarat
79.article_body: Ahead of Gujarat polls, AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal promised a law for the protection of advocates and a scheme to provide fresh law graduates a ₹5,000 monthly stipend if the party comes to power. "Lawyers are very powerful. If all the lawyers get united and determined then they can make any party win or lose," said Kejriwal.

80.title: Akshay was told 'Tumhari aukat nai hain ki film ke poster lag sake': Darshan
80.article_body: Sharing his conversation with Akshay Kumar before the release of 'Jaanwar', director-producer Suneel Darshan stated, "Akshay...said, 'Suneel ji, I'm going through so many problems'." "The producer of the movie which released on Friday hasn't put up posters...[He]...told me, 'You're not at the status where your film posters and hoardings can be put up'," added Darshan, recalling Akshay's words.

81.title: Delhi LG can't enjoy power without accountability: AAP's Saurabh Bharadwaj
81.article_body: After the Delhi High Court directed that a PIL be filed over the deaths of two manual scavengers in Delhi's Mundka, AAP spokesperson Saurabh Bharadwaj said that the Delhi LG VK Saxena cannot "enjoy power without accountability". "The DDA, which comes directly under the LG, is responsible for these two deaths," Bharadwaj added.

82.title: 7-star resort worth ₹200 cr in Kerala to be demolished over coastal rules violations
82.article_body: A seven-star resort worth ₹200 crore, situated on an island in the backwaters of the Vembanad Lake in Kerala's Alappuzha, will be demolished for violating Coastal Regulation Zone rules. This comes after the Kerala government took back possession of a piece of land from Kapico Kerala Resorts Private Limited. Supreme Court in 2020 had ordered the demolition of the resort.

83.title: NYT offers lunch boxes as return to work perk, staff says 'we want fair contracts'
83.article_body: The New York Times offered its staff branded lunch boxes as a return-to-office perk as hundreds of them protested against the move, demanding fair contracts instead. An employee, while sharing the lunch box's photo, wrote, "My colleagues and I don't need cute trinkets. 330 of us wrote emails...asking for real raises to combat inflation….What we need is a contract."

84.title: Sunny took signing money for film but refused to honour commitment: Producer
84.article_body: Producer Suneel Darshan has spoken about his falling out with actor Sunny Deol in an interview, saying that the actor took the signing fee for a film and later refused to honour the commitment. He further said that he released the 1996 film 'Ajay' without an ending because Sunny had gone to London and refused to come back on time.

85.title: Shashi Tharoor posts pic with Kunal Kamra after comedian's Gurugram show gets cancelled
85.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has shared a photo of him with Kunal Kamra after the comedian's show in Gurugram was cancelled amid VHP protests. Tharoor tweeted, "It's awful Kunal Kamra's show was cancelled, just like Vir Das and Munawar Faruqui earlier." He added, "What's our country coming to when a bunch of goons can intimidate organisers and censor free speech?"

86.title: Dog gifted by 18-yr-old's mother separated from him at US border; last pic goes viral
86.article_body: An 18-year-old Venezuelan migrant was separated from his dog at the US border, with their last picture going viral. The dog named Brandy had been a gift from Brayan Pinto's mother before her death to become his emotional support pet. Pinto handed over the dog to a photo journalist who agreed to take care of her in Mexico.

87.title: DDA launches housing scheme for 8,500 flats in Narela
87.article_body: The Delhi Development Authority (DDA) has launched its online housing scheme for 8,500 flats in Narela. The flats will be sold on a first come first serve basis to Economically Weaker Section (EWS) and Lower Income Group (LIG) households. The booking amount for EWS category flats is fixed at ₹10,000 and for LIG flats the booking amount is ₹15,000.

88.title: Protests in TN over tribal kids not being given eggs at school
88.article_body: Protests have erupted in a tribal settlement in Tamil Nadu's Krishnagiri after the children of the Irula community were not provided eggs during midday meals at their school. The school's headmaster said that he had reminded the noon meal organiser to supply eggs but she had not agreed. Eggs are not being supplied due to rains, officials claimed.

89.title: Ukrainian Prez urges West for more arms as troops recapture territory
89.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has called upon the West to speed up deliveries of weapons as troops plan to consolidate control over northeastern territory. Ukrainian troops have recaptured dozens of towns since Moscow abandoned its main bastion near Kharkiv. US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said Ukraine has "benefitted from significant support from the US and other countries".

90.title: Ghaziabad doctor gets beheading threat for supporting Hindu groups, probe on
90.article_body: A Ghaziabad doctor allegedly received threatening calls, warning him not to support Hindu outfits or else, he will be beheaded. Dr Arvind Vats alleged that he received calls from a United States number, Circle Officer Alok Dubey said. The caller reportedly told Vats that neither PM Narendra Modi nor Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath would be able to protect him.

91.title: Salman Khan meets Jain monk as the latter accomplishes 180-day fast
91.article_body: Actor Salman Khan recently met Jain monk Acharya Vijay Hansratnasur as the latter completed his 180 days of fasting. Acharya Vijay Hansratnasur is the only Jain monk to complete the 180-day fast for the sixth time. During their interaction, Salman went on to learn about Jainism and spoke about celebrities who have met the Acharya to seek his blessings.

92.title: Jindal University student found dead outside campus, family allege ragging
92.article_body: A 19-year-old second-year student of OP Jindal Global University was found dead outside the campus on an under-construction road in Haryana's Sonepat, police said. "The student had gone to visit his sister in Delhi...on Sunday his body was found outside the campus," police added. "The family has filed a complaint alleging some students had been ragging the victim," police stated.

93.title: OTT is brave new world for actresses: Somy Ali
93.article_body: Actress-activist Somy Ali called OTT platforms "a brave new world for female actors". She said there used to be a "genuine bias towards women" after they crossed the age of 35. However, she stated she has seen it "changing and disappearing", which she called a "sign of progress". Somy said in the 90s, the leading ladies were only props.

94.title: He is already married: Richa corrects journo who mixed Ali Fazal with Zafar
94.article_body: Actress Richa Chadha corrected a journalist's tweet who had mistakenly tagged Pakistani actor-singer Ali Zafar instead of actor Ali Fazal in a now-deleted tweet about Richa and Ali's wedding. Richa wrote, "Ali Zafar is a Pakistani singer/actor, who is already married." Their wedding festivities will reportedly begin on September 30 in Delhi and conclude on October 7 in Mumbai.

95.title: Kangana shares first look of Vishak Nair as Sanjay Gandhi in 'Emergency'
95.article_body: Actress-filmmaker Kangana Ranaut has shared the first look of actor Vishak Nair as Sanjay Gandhi from her upcoming directorial 'Emergency'. She wrote alongside the poster, "Presenting the powerhouse of talent...Sanjay was the soul of Indira...the man she loved and lost." Kangana will portray former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi in the film, which also features Anupam Kher and Shreyas Talpade.

96.title: Not intensely looking at it right now: Arjun on becoming producer
96.article_body: Arjun Kapoor said he wants to produce films and have a 360-degree perspective on filmmaking. While he said his switch from being an actor to a producer "could happen anytime", it's not something he's "intensely looking at right now". He said he is grateful for the opportunities that he's getting and hopes to deliver something fantastic in the upcoming films.

97.title: Why would public take permission from thieves: BJP leader on Nabanna march
97.article_body: When asked about BJP not getting permission from the police to hold Nabanna (State Secretariat) rally, West Bengal BJP president Sukanta Majumdar said, "Why would public take permission from thieves to hold demonstrations?" "Police [is] behaving like TMC cadres...We did Nabanna march last time when Section 144 was imposed, we'll do it again...It's our fight to save Bengal," he added.

98.title: Pune man chases girls playing in garden, shows them obscene videos
98.article_body: Pune City Police have booked a 53-year-old man who allegedly chased minor girls who were playing in a garden and showed them obscene videos on his mobile phone in Khadki. Another man who was in the garden had apparently tried to catch the accused, however, he managed to escape. One of the girls' fathers had filed an FIR on Sunday.

99.title: Siraj picks 4 wickets on Day 1 of his county debut for Warwickshire
99.article_body: India's Mohammed Siraj picked four wickets for Warwickshire on Day 1 of his County Championship debut match against Somerset. Siraj first dismissed opener Imam-ul-Haq in the 10th over and George Bartlett and James Rew on back-to-back deliveries in the 22nd to help reduce Somerset to 46/5. The 28-year-old then sent back Josh Davey, picking his fourth wicket of the day.

100.title: Mysterious 'moving train' of lights spotted in sky in Uttar Pradesh; pics viral
100.article_body: People in Lucknow, Kanpur and several other Uttar Pradesh cities spotted a mysterious string of lights in the night sky on Monday. Sharing pictures and videos on social media, people said that the dotted trail of lights was "moving like a train". While many speculated that they could be UFOs, the lights are most likely to be recently launched satellites.

101.title: CBI conducts pan-India raids over J&K Police SI recruitment scam
101.article_body: The CBI is conducting raids at 33 locations across the country in connection with the irregularities in the Jammu and Kashmir Police Sub-Inspector (JKPSI) recruitment exam. The locations where raids are underway include Jammu, Srinagar, Karnal, Mahendragarh, Rewari, Delhi, Ghaziabad and Bengaluru, according to an official. The paper of the exam, which was conducted in March, was allegedly leaked.

102.title: Getting sense of accomplishment by just being here: Radhika on TIFF
102.article_body: Radhika Madan said she got a "sense of accomplishment by just being" at the Toronto International Film Festival (TIFF). The actress attended premiere of her film 'Kacchey Limbu', which received standing ovation at TIFF. Radhika said it was "overwhelming" to be part of the Shubham Yogi's directorial debut. She said her "childhood memories helped" to channelise emotions for her performance.

103.title: It's 'Congress Jodo Yatra' not 'Bharat Jodo Yatra': Goa CM Pramod Sawant
103.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant criticised the Congress over its "Bharat Jodo Yatra" and called it "Congress Jodo Yatra". He also accused the party of splitting the nation. Sawant said, "Congress created Pakistan by splitting India before Independence. They are targeting BJP and RSS by burning RSS uniform. BJP and RSS have always talked about 'Bharat Jodna'."

104.title: Mumbai Police uses 'Brahmastra' movie reference in road safety tweet
104.article_body: The Mumbai Traffic Police shared 'Brahmastra' movie reference in a tweet to spread awareness about road safety. Referring to the movie characters, the police wrote, "Junoon and Raftar can put your 'Universe' at risk." "Even if you have Vanar Astra, don't jump the signal and even if you have Nandi Astra, don't use the strength on accelerator," it added.

105.title: Pakistan court extends ex-PM Imran Khan's bail in terrorism case
105.article_body: An anti-terrorism court in Islamabad on Monday extended the bail granted to Pakistan's former Prime Minister Imran Khan in an anti-terrorism case till September 20. Khan was booked under the Anti-Terrorism Act for allegedly threatening an additional sessions judge and police officials at a rally in Islamabad. Earlier, Khan warned he would become "more dangerous" if he's sent to jail.

106.title: 3-year-old nursery student raped by driver inside school bus in MP
106.article_body: A three-year-old nursery student was raped allegedly by her school bus driver inside the vehicle in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal, police said on Tuesday. Police arrested the bus driver and a woman attendant who, according to the child's parents, was present inside the vehicle when the incident took place last Thursday. The child was returning home when the incident took place.

107.title: Pet kangaroo kills owner, tries to stop medics from accessing his body in Australia
107.article_body: A pet kangaroo killed its 77-year-old owner in Australia's Redmond, the country's first fatal kangaroo attack in more than 85 years. Emergency services were called to the scene, but the kangaroo prevented paramedics from accessing the man's body, as it became violent. Police said they had to kill the animal, as it "was posing an ongoing threat to emergency responders".

108.title: Drew parallel from my relationship with daughter for 'Jersey': Shahid
108.article_body: Shahid Kapoor said for 'Jersey', which also focused on a father-son relationship, he took references from his relationship with daughter Misha. "It was more with my daughter Misha at that point in time, Zain was way younger. So, the parallel I had here was with my daughter," he said. 'Jersey' was remake of the Telugu film with the same name.

109.title: Germany seeks talks with Switzerland on nuclear waste site controversy
109.article_body: Germany is seeking to hold talks with Switzerland over the proposal of sending nuclear waste to a repository near German border. The German Environment Ministry warned that the nuclear repository site would "heavily burden communities on the German side". Swiss authorities have indicated that they are open to making payments, although compensation for affected regions is yet to be discussed.

110.title: Sikh man with kirpan stopped from entering Delhi Metro, NCM seeks report
110.article_body: National Commission for Minorities (NCM) sought a report from the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) and Delhi Chief Secretary after a Sikh man, with kirpan, alleged he was stopped from entering the metro. The incident took place at Dwarka Sector 21 station on September 8. The man claimed he was stopped by security personnel and asked to remove the kirpan.

111.title: US TV host says India hasn't built 'beautiful' structures like Britishers, Tharoor replies
111.article_body: Fox News host Tucker Carlson said that India has not built a single structure "as beautiful as the Bombay train station the British colonialists built". Shashi Tharoor tweeted, "I think Twitter ought to have an option for something to press when you can't respond without losing your cool." Tharoor added he will content himself with angry emojis for now.

112.title: All illegal buildings in B'luru to be demolished like Noida twin towers: K'taka minister
112.article_body: Following the Bengaluru flooding, Karnataka Revenue Minister R Ashoka said that by the next monsoon, all illegal buildings will be demolished on the line of the Noida twin towers. "All apartments will be led off, as you saw in Noida. Action to be [taken] against officials...builders," he added. "The discussion regarding Bengaluru floods happened in the Assembly," Ashoka stated.

113.title: India just have to find clarity over no. 5 spot: Uthappa on squad for T20 WC
113.article_body: Indian veteran batter Robin Uthappa has said Team India's top-four and the lower-middle order for the T20 World Cup looks "extremely formidable". He added, "India just have to find clarity over that number five spot...That would be between Rishabh Pant and Deepak Hooda." The BCCI on Monday announced India's 15-member squad for the T20 World Cup.

114.title: Modi govt out to loot farmers, grab their land: Telangana CM KCR
114.article_body: While criticising the central government's power reforms, Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao said the BJP-led government and its local leaders were misleading people by saying that those were good reforms. "In reality, the Narendra Modi government just wants to loot farmers, grab their land and give [it] to private entrepreneurs," KCR said in the Assembly on Monday.

115.title: E-buses to run under free shuttle service from Delhi Secretariat
115.article_body: Delhi government plans to deploy e-buses to launch a free shuttle service from Delhi Secretariat to nearby metro stations and bus stops. The city's General Administration Department will be in charge of paying for the free bus service, a senior government official said. "Last week, GAD wrote to the transport department requesting for e-buses to run shuttle service," he added.

116.title: 1,561 youths joined militancy, 7,935 surrendered since 2016: Assam CM
116.article_body: As many as 1,561 youths have joined militant groups in Assam since 2016, said CM Himanta Biswa Sarma in a written reply in the state Assembly. "During the period 7,935 cadres of 23 different militant outfits surrendered and joined the mainstream," he added. A total of 84 persons have been arrested for Jihadi activities, he said.

117.title: Provocative song played in front of mosque in K'taka; case filed
117.article_body: The police have registered a suo moto case against organisers and a DJ owner after a provocative song was allegedly played in front of a mosque during a Ganesh Visarjan procession in Karnataka's Kalaburagi. This comes after a video of the incident surfaced online. The incident occurred on September 10 when the procession apparently stopped in front of the mosque.

118.title: 15,000 'overworked' nurses in US' Minnesota go on a 3-day strike
118.article_body: Some 15,000 nurses in the US state of Minnesota have gone on strike to protest against understaffing at hospitals. The Minnesota Nurses Association said health workers have been exhausted due to understaffing. The union said the three-day strike is one of the largest in the US history. Senator Bernie Sanders tweeted, "Nurses are the backbone of our health care system."

119.title: Viral video shows 3 kids travelling in open car boot in Telangana; police responds
119.article_body: A video showing three kids sitting in the boot of a moving car in Telangana went viral online. A Twitter user, who shared the video, sought action, saying, "How irresponsible parents they are?" Responding to the tweet, Cyberabad Traffic Police said, "Sir, your information has been verified and E-Challan has been generated. Thanks for joining hands...in improving road safety."

120.title: Mukul Rohatgi to return as Attorney General on October 1: Reports
120.article_body: Veteran lawyer Mukul Rohatgi is most likely to become the Attorney General for India again. According to reports, Rohatgi has agreed to succeed the current A-G KK Venugopal and is likely to begin his second tenure on October 1. Earlier, he had held the Attorney General post from June 2014 to June 2017.

121.title: Funeral directors' ad on hearse carrying Queen's body to Edinburgh removed mid-way
121.article_body: The branding of a funeral directors' company on Queen Elizabeth II's hearse was removed mid-way as it drove through Scotland. The sticker of the company, William Purves, was emblazoned on the vehicle as it departed Balmoral Castle on Sunday for a six-hour journey south to Holyroodhouse in Edinburgh. The company's website crashed after the advertisement was seen on the hearse.

122.title: BJP plunged J&K into unprecedented political uncertainty: Congress leader
122.article_body: The Congress on Monday alleged that BJP has pushed J&K into unprecedented political uncertainty by failing to maintain law and order in the Union Territory. "BJP...[has] been on a rampage of dispossessing and disempowering common people of Jammu and Kashmir. We've been used as political cannon fodders by BJP all across the country," J&K Congress chief Vikar Rasool Wani said.

123.title: KCR forming national party for his son: BJP MP K Laxman
123.article_body: After Telangana CM KCR announced that he will form a national political party, BJP MP K Laxman accused the CM of floating the national party for his son. "This party will be for his son to take over in Telangana...We have no problem with KCR forming a party at the national level or expanding his family party," said Laxman.

124.title: Road caves in due to sewerage pipe leak in Punjab's Ludhiana
124.article_body: A portion of a road has caved in near a level crossing in Punjab's Ludhiana with preliminary investigations revealing that the incident occurred due to leakage from the sewerage pipe of a nearby restaurant. A zonal commissioner said that the maintenance work will disrupt traffic as the area around the leakage needs to be dug up to check for damage.

125.title: BJP won't join freebie battle in Himachal Pradesh: CM Jairam Thakur
125.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur said BJP will not join the freebie battle in the poll-bound state. Referring to the pre-poll freebies matter, Thakur added, "The people of Himachal are wise enough to sift through such hollow promises. They are not fools." Furthermore, he said that "the Congress is leaderless" in the absence of ex-CM late Virbhadra Singh.

126.title: 13-year-old raped by man she met online in Vadodara, accused held
126.article_body: A 13-year-old girl has been allegedly raped by a man she befriended on a social media site who lured her into accompanying him to a birthday party in Gujarat's Vadodara. The accused took her to his residence and threatened to kill her if she avoided his advances. The accused has been arrested following an FIR by the victim's father.

127.title: Nifty crosses 18,000 for 1st time since April, Sensex above 60,000
127.article_body: The benchmark indices opened in the green on Tuesday backed by gains across global markets. The Nifty opened 99.50 points up at 18,035.80, crossing the 18,000 mark for the first time since April 5. The Sensex also opened 329.73 points higher at 60,444.86 points. Stocks of Reliance Industries, Bajaj Finance, Titan Company and Infosys were among the major BSE gainers.

128.title: Rupee rises to 79.29 against US dollar, biggest jump in 3 weeks
128.article_body: The rupee registered its biggest jump in three weeks on Tuesday by gaining 23 paise to 79.29 against the US dollar from Monday's close of 79.52. The strengthening of the rupee was supported by a fall in global crude oil prices and also the American currency. The dollar index was last down by 0.2% at 107.9.

129.title: 'Only one will be left if I fight' says Ashok Chandna to Pilot after shoe thrown at him
129.article_body: After supporters of Rajasthan's former Deputy Chief Minister Sachin Pilot allegedly hurled shoes at meeting attended by BJP and Congress leaders, state Sports Minister Ashok Chandna named him in a tweet. "If Sachin Pilot becomes...Chief Minister by throwing...shoe at me...he should be made [CM] soon...I don't feel like fighting...The day I come to fight...only one will be left," he tweeted.

130.title: Priyanka Chopra shares glimpse of her walk-in closet in LA home
130.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra took to Instagram Stories to share a mirror selfie showing her walk-in closet in her Los Angeles residence with husband Nick Jonas. Brown and black boots can be seen on racks on one side of the walls. White shoes are mounted on shelves on the opposite side. Trolley bags can be seen lined up near the door.

131.title: Kareena Kapoor, Neetu Kapoor shoot together for first time; share pics
131.article_body: Actresses Kareena Kapoor and Neetu Kapoor will be sharing screen space for the first time. The two took to Instagram Stories to share pictures from the shoot of the unknown project. Kareena shared a selfie, writing, "When you shoot with family..." Neetu reposted the story, writing, "Loveee her." Neetu's late husband Rishi Kapoor and Kareena's father Randhir Kapoor are brothers.

132.title: Nation still bleeding, punish retired policeman who failed to act during 1984 riots: Delhi HC
132.article_body: Delhi High Court has granted liberty to Disciplinary Authority to issue "appropriate order of punishment" to a 79-year-old retired police officer who allegedly failed to deploy adequate force and make preventive detentions during the 1984 anti-Sikh riots. "He may be 100 (years old). Kindly see the misconduct. Innocent people lost their lives. The nation is still bleeding," the court said.

133.title: 2 bike-borne men shoot at woman sitting outside house in Delhi
133.article_body: A 55-year-old woman was injured after two bike-borne men allegedly shot at her in Delhi's Bhalswa Dairy area, police said on Tuesday. The woman, who is from Rajasthan, had come to meet her daughter in Prakash Vihar and was sitting outside the house with the daughter and her granddaughter when the incident occurred, DCP (Outer North) Devesh Kumar Mahla said.

134.title: FIR against 3 as 8 killed in fire at e-bike showroom at Secunderabad
134.article_body: An FIR has been filed against three persons after eight persons died following a massive fire that engulfed an electric bike showroom and a lodge above it at Secunderabad, police said. A case has been registered against the owner of the building and the showroom owner. The victims were all staying in the lodge located above the showroom, police added.

135.title: Ray of sun shines down on Queen's coffin; pic goes viral
135.article_body: A picture showing a ray of sun shining down on the Queen's coffin during a procession to transport her body to St Giles' Cathedral in Edinburgh has gone viral. The picture captured by Georgie Gillard was shared on Instagram by Story Picture Agency. Earlier, a double rainbow appeared over the Buckingham Palace after the demise of the Queen.

136.title: I have a bone edema issue, I couldn't run or walk: World no. 5 Zverev on injury
136.article_body: World number five Alexander Zverev, who hasn't played since June due to an ankle injury he suffered in his French Open semi-final against Rafa Nadal, has revealed that his comeback could be delayed by months due to a bone edema issue. "It causes me a lot of pain…it got to the point where I couldn't run or walk," he stated.

137.title: DVAC conducts searches at 26 places linked to ex-AIADMK minister SP Velumani
137.article_body: Directorate of Vigilance and Anti-Corruption is conducting searches at 26 places linked to former AIADMK minister SP Velumani in connection with allegations that he had abused his official position in awarding tenders injudiciously to his close associated companies. Meanwhile, Tamil Nadu Police detained seven AIADMK MLAs and several workers for protesting outside Velumani's Coimbatore residence.

138.title: Notice issued to textbook publisher over missing words in national anthem
138.article_body: UP Basic Education Department has issued a show-cause notice to a class 5 textbook publisher over national anthem being published with two words missing. Notices have also been issued to Basic Shiksha Adhikari (BSA) of Mathura and divisional education assistant director, Basic, Agra who were responsible for checking textbooks for any printing errors before they were distributed to students.

139.title: Police hooter should strike fear in criminals: UP CM Yogi Adityanath
139.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday said a police hooter itself should strike fear in criminals and be enough to make them "tremble". "Criminals shouldn't be spared under any circumstances. From day one, we've taken pledge to eliminate criminals in UP and our government is doing it," CM Yogi added. He was reviewing the law and order situation in Baghpat.

140.title: We have retaken 6,000 sq km from Russia: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy
140.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday said that since the beginning of the month, Ukrainian forces have retaken more than 6,000 square kilometers of Russian-held territory in the east and south. "The movement of our troops continues," Zelenskyy added. Russia had admitted losing key cities in the north-eastern Kharkiv region. Russia began its invasion of Ukraine on February 24.

141.title: Kerala govt plans to kill violent dogs, to seek SC permission
141.article_body: The Kerala government has decided to seek permission from the Supreme Court to kill rabid and violent dogs. The state is planning to conduct a month-long drive from September 20 to contain dog menace. "[The] situation is really serious…We have decided to…devise several plans to contain mounting dog bite cases," said Local Self Government Minister M B Rajesh.

142.title: Car catches fire on highway in Mumbai, Maha CM Shinde stops to help; video surfaces
142.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Tuesday stopped on Mumbai's Western Express Highway in the Vile Parle area to help the occupant of a car which caught fire. A video of the incident has surfaced online wherein Shinde can be seen speaking to the car driver. A fire official said that two fire engines were rushed and the fire was doused.

143.title: Men used to decide which actress they want to work with back then: Mandakini
143.article_body: Veteran actress Mandakini, who made her debut in 1985, has said that in those days, men used to decide which actress they want to work with. "That was a male-oriented period. During those days heroines were not very much in demand. They were just used only for 3-4 songs and very few romantic scenes," the actress added.

144.title: Parts of Bengaluru to face power cuts today and tomorrow
144.article_body: The Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) said that there will be scheduled power shutdowns in the city for the rest of the month as it will carry out maintenance and repair works in rain-affected areas. BESCOM shared a list of places that will face power outages today and tomorrow which includes areas like Ramanagara, HSR Layout, Jayanagar, etc.

145.title: Indian-origin girl dies on b'day after being left alone for hours in Qatar school bus
145.article_body: A four-year-old Indian-origin girl, Minsa Mariyam Jacob, was found dead inside her school bus on her birthday in Qatar. Minsa, a kindergarten student, was locked inside the bus for hours after the crew didn't notice that she was sleeping. "The vehicle was left behind and she got stuck inside it in high heat," her relative said.

146.title: People attacked me on social media when I criticised Rizwan: Akram
146.article_body: Discussing Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Muhammad Rizwan's 55 (49) in the Asia Cup final against Sri Lanka, ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram said, "(Rizwan)...[did] the same thing against Hong Kong." "I criticised him...People attacked me on social media," added Akram. "If you want my opinion, I will give you the...straightforward opinion. I'm not the guy who'll lie about what I see," he stated.

147.title: Shah removed Article 370 like teacher erases dirty letters: Union Minister
147.article_body: Union Minister Parshottam Rupala on Monday said that Home Minister Amit Shah removed Article 370 just like a "good teacher erases dirty letters from the blackboard". Rupala was speaking at World Dairy Summit 2022 at Greater Noida, which was also attended by Shah and UP CM Yogi Adityanath. Rupala praised Shah for his "tremendous amount of political will power".

148.title: I would love to work with Kapil: Asgar on returning to ‘The Kapil...’
148.article_body: Discussing his reaction to a potential offer from comedian Kapil Sharma over rejoining 'The Kapil Sharma Show', comedian Ali Asgar said, "I'd love to work with him...[and] do something new." "There's no enmity," added Asgar. Asgar had quit the show in 2017, stating he "can't cheat" as an artiste. Kapil had earlier stated that he'd "block" Asgar following his exit.

149.title: I think my opportunity will definitely come: Rahul Tripathi
149.article_body: Batter Rahul Tripathi, who is yet to make his India debut despite being part of squads for Ireland T20Is and Zimbabwe ODIs, has said that he's happy that he has now "at least come into the scheme of things". "I think my opportunity will definitely come, and my job is to keep performing in whatever opportunities I get," he added.

150.title: Pune to face water cuts from 10 pm on Sept 14 to 10 pm on Sept 15
150.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation has announced that parts of the city will face water cuts from 10 pm on September 14 to 10 pm on September 15 due to the planned installation of flow meters. Water supply will resume on September 16 in the morning with low pressure, it added. Places like Fatimanagar and Pune Cantonment Board area will be affected.

151.title: Cong harboured hatred for us, wants to connect people through hatred: RSS
151.article_body: RSS Joint General Secretary Dr Manmohan Vaidya on Monday said that the Congress wants to connect people through hatred. "Can you unite India through hatred? They have harboured hatred and contempt for us for a long time. Their earlier generations too tried to stop the RSS but we kept growing as we were supported by the people," Vaidya added.

152.title: Always resorting to slander: Banerjee to Opposition leaders criticising Bengal
152.article_body: Days after Enforcement Directorate (ED) seized cash worth crores from a Kolkata-based businessman, CM Mamata Banerjee criticised some political parties for trying to only create a negative image of the state. "They are always resorting to slander. Had they highlighted the positive works of the state government, both Bengal and its people would have benefited," she said.

153.title: 32-year-old co-pilot found dead at home in Delhi, probe underway
153.article_body: Police have started investigation after a 32-year-old co-pilot with a private airline was found dead at his residence in Delhi’s Palam. The deceased, who was reportedly found dead on Saturday, was married and hailed from Kerala, officials said. Police suspected it to be a suicide, adding that the deceased might have taken the step as he failed in an exam.

154.title: 2 arrested for planting explosive near basketball ground in Imphal
154.article_body: Two people have been arrested for planting an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) near a basketball ground at Singjamei Chingamakha in Manipur's Imphal, said police. One of the two suspects, Kshetrimayum Bhogendro Singh, who was caught first, revealed he is an active member of insurgent group UNLF, according to police. His disclosure led to the arrest of the other suspect.

155.title: We shot in -22°C, I had nosebleeds, bruises, allergies: Mrunal on 'Sita Ramam'
155.article_body: While talking about her movie 'Sita Ramam', actress Mrunal Thakur said that shooting for it was challenging. "There are so many layers in the character. And you would not believe it, the weather over there was so challenging. We've shot in like minus 22 degrees, in places where I've had like nosebleeds, bruises and allergies," she added.

156.title: Fresh clashes erupt between Azerbaijan, Armenia
156.article_body: Fresh clashes between Armenian and Azerbaijan forces were reported on Monday, which has left an unknown number of troops dead. The fighting reportedly took place in the disputed Nagorno-Karabakh region, and both the countries have blamed each other for the initial provocations. The two sides had fought a six-week-long war over Nagorno-Karabakh in 2020, which ended with a Russian-brokered deal.

157.title: Saba Azad reveals why she changed name from Saba Grewal, says 'Azad was nani’s pen name'
157.article_body: Singer-actress Saba Azad has revealed why she changed her name from Saba Grewal, stating, "My father is of Sikh origin and my mother of Muslim, but neither practiced religion." Adding that Azad was her nani's (grandmother) pen name, she said, "I liked the...meaning...The want for freedom is the most human instinct. So I adopted it as my stage name."

158.title: Goldman Sachs preparing for layoffs across all departments in Sept: Report
158.article_body: Goldman Sachs is preparing to make its first round of layoffs since the outbreak of the pandemic, as per a report. It is expected to cut jobs across all departments as soon as next week. The bank usually initiates a round of layoffs, called Strategic Resource Assessment, annually, on the basis of employee performance and can terminate 1-5% of workers.

159.title: Nintendo shares surge 5% after record launch sales of 'Splatoon 3'
159.article_body: Shares of Nintendo surged 5% on Tuesday after the gaming company reported domestic launch sales of over 3.45 million units for its shooter "Splatoon 3" on the Switch console. "Splatoon 3", which was launched on September 9, exceeded the sales of "Animal Crossing: New Horizons" and "Super Smash Bros. Ultimate", which respectively sold 39.4 million and 28.8 million units globally.

160.title: HDFC Life Insurance shares surge 2.5% after reports of block deal
160.article_body: Shares of HDFC Life Insurance surged in Tuesday's opening trade after reports of a block deal in which around 43 million shares, or a 2% stake of the firm, changed hands. At 9:17 am, its stock was trading at ₹594 on the BSE, a jump of 2.5%. Edinburgh-based Abrdn is reportedly expected to offload 43 million shares in the company.

161.title: What is inside the 2022 Emmy Awards' gift bag?
161.article_body: Celebrities will receive a trip to Four Seasons Nevis in the West Indies. Other trip alternatives for Emmys 2022 attendees include three-night stay at the RiverView Ranch Retreat & Western Adventures in Montana and a three-night stay at the Museum Hotel in Cappadocia, Turkey. The gift bag also has skincare products, canned drinks, bag of caramels and everyday essentials.

162.title: Asif batted with 4 stitches, Shadab's ear was bleeding: Pak's Saqlain on Asia Cup final
162.article_body: Pakistan head coach Saqlain Mushtaq has revealed that Asif Ali batted with four stitches in his hand and Shadab Khan batted despite his ear bleeding during the Asia Cup 2022 final. Asif was dismissed for a golden duck while Shadab got out for eight runs off six deliveries as Pakistan lost the final by 23 runs.

163.title: Surprised at omission of Shreyas & Shami: Azharuddin on India's T20 World Cup 2022 squad
163.article_body: Ex-India captain Mohammed Azharuddin took to Twitter to share that he is surprised at the omission of batter Shreyas Iyer and fast bowler Mohammad Shami from India's main T20 World Cup 2022 squad. "Shreyas instead of Deepak Hooda and Shami in the place of Harshal Patel would be my choice," he added. Shreyas and Shami have been named as standbys.

164.title: Attacked by monkeys, 5-year-old boy falls to death from roof in UP
164.article_body: A five-year-old boy playing on the roof of his house fell to death after he was reportedly attacked by a group of monkeys in UP's Budaun district on Sunday. The victim, Nikhil, was rushed to a hospital but he did not survive. His family refused to send the body for autopsy, said a police official.

165.title: Infosys warns staff against moonlighting, says 'No two-timing, no double lives': Report
165.article_body: Infosys has warned employees against dual employment or 'moonlighting', stating that any violation will lead to disciplinary action, including termination of employment, the Times of India reported. With the taglines 'No two-timing, no moonlighting' and 'No double lives', Infosys told employees they cannot take up other assignments during or outside business hours without seeking its consent.

166.title: Supreme Court Collegium clears names of 20 judges for High Courts
166.article_body: The Supreme Court Collegium, headed by Chief Justice of India UU Lalit, has cleared the names of 20 judges for the High Courts of Punjab and Haryana, Bombay and Karnataka. Those recommended for elevation include 15 judicial officers, three Additional Judges and two advocates. Nine judicial officers have been elevated as judges in Punjab and Haryana High Court.

167.title: SC asks govt to pay ₹10 lakh to man who claimed to have spent 14 yrs in Pak jail as spy
167.article_body: Supreme Court has ordered Centre to pay ₹10 lakh to 75-year-old Mahmood Ansari, who claimed to have worked as a spy in the 1970s and served 14 years in Pakistani jail under the espionage charge. Ansari was terminated from his job in India in 1980. "The standard practice of any government is to disown its special agents," the court observed.

168.title: Punjab gym owner locks door from inside, shoots himself in head; critical
168.article_body: A 32-year-old gymnasium owner in Punjab's Ludhiana allegedly shot himself in the head with his revolver at his gym on Monday. His condition is said to be critical. Reports said that he had bolted the door from inside before taking the step. His wife had sent someone to check after he did not respond to calls.

169.title: 'Squid Game' star Lee Jung-jae 1st Asian to win Emmy for lead actor in drama series
169.article_body: South Korean actor Lee Jung-jae won the award for lead actor in a drama series for his role in 'Squid Game' at the 74th Primetime Emmy Awards. He is the first Asian actor to win the award and the first to win it for a non-English-speaking role. Notably, 'Squid Game' was the first non-English language series nominated in Drama category.

170.title: Acceptance from audience only reward we work for: Ayan on Brahmāstra success
170.article_body: Ayan Mukerji took to Instagram to pen a note about the success of his directorial 'Brahmāstra'. He wrote, "The Acceptance from Audiences - is the only reward we work for at the movies. We were also the #1 Movie at the Global Box-Office this weekend...another source of pride, excitement and progress, for us!" 'Brahmāstra' stars Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt.

171.title: Light rain, drizzle expected in parts of Delhi: IMD
171.article_body: The India Meteorological Department has predicted light rain and drizzle in parts of Delhi today. "As the depression moves and comes closer towards northwest India, the rain intensity will increase. On Wednesday, strong winds are expected, which will be accompanied by light rain. On Thursday, light to moderate rain will occur around Delhi," said IMD scientist RK Jenamani.

172.title: Kenan jokes about Leonardo's girlfriends, Oscars slap in Emmys monologue
172.article_body: Actor-comedian Kenan Thompson hosted the 2022 Primetime Emmy Awards and joked about actor Leonardo DiCaprio's girlfriends and Will Smith slapping Chris Rock at the Oscars 2022 in his opening monologue. He said, "Zendaya just turned 26 last week. 26 is a weird age in Hollywood...You're young enough to play a high school student but...too old to date Leonardo DiCaprio."

173.title: Helping 2000+ professionals in switching to Data Science career: Scaler
