173.article_body: Scaler's Data Science & Machine Learning with Analytics program is helping 2000+ working professionals to switch their career paths and transition to data science. With a chance to learn hands-on with 80+ business case studies, more working professionals are choosing this online course without quitting jobs, it stated. For those looking to transition from non-tech backgrounds to data science, the Free Class has been the perfect place to start, stated Scaler.

174.title: 30-year-old rapper PnB Rock dies after being shot, robbed at a restaurant in US
174.article_body: Rapper PnB Rock, whose real name was Rakim Allen, passed away after he was shot multiple times at a restaurant in Los Angeles, US. The 30-year-old was dining at the restaurant with his girlfriend when a man brandished a firearm, demanding jewellery from him. A location-tagged photo posted by his girlfriend is believed to have led assailants to his location.

175.title: India reports 4,369 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 46,347
175.article_body: India has reported 4,369 COVID-19 cases and 18 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 5,221 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in the country stood at 46,347, while the daily positivity rate stood at 1.25%. India reported 5,178 recoveries in the last 24 hours.

176.title: JD(U) spokesperson Nikhil Mandal resigns citing 'personal' reasons
176.article_body: JD(U) spokesperson Nikhil Mandal resigned from the post citing "personal reasons". "In these six years, seven months and 12 days, I received immense love and respect from all the media colleagues, for which I thank all of you from my heart," he said. Mandal had contested the 2020 Assembly elections from Madhepura which he had lost to RJD's Dr Chandrashekhar.

177.title: Demolition process of Mumbai's illegal Gulistan Apartments begins
177.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has started the demolition process of the Gulistan Apartments, which is a building with 90 flats, in Mumbai and disconnected the electricity and water supply on Monday. "As this is a sensitive issue, we waited for Ramzan and Ganeshotsav...We will bring it to ground zero at the earliest," an officer who oversees the demolition said.

178.title: Don't celebrate Hindi Diwas on taxpayer's money: Kumaraswamy to K'taka CM
178.article_body: JD(S) leader HD Kumaraswamy on Monday urged Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai not to celebrate Hindi Diwas by utilising the taxpayers' money. In a letter, the former Karnataka Chief Minister noted that thousands of languages, dialects, and diverse social and cultural practices make India a "great union". "In such a land, celebrating one particular language is injustice," Kumaraswamy added.

179.title: Rajasthan government is insensitive towards cow protection: Rajyavardhan
179.article_body: BJP MP Rajyavardhan Rathore accused the Rajasthan government of being insensitive towards cows and claimed that the government is running away from the responsibility of protecting the "Gauvansh" in the state. "Thousands of cattle have died in Rajasthan due to lumpy skin disease. More than 10 lakh cows are affected...The government is not worried about protecting the cows," said Rathore.

180.title: K'taka HC told hijab is essential religious practice, had to interpret Quran: SC
180.article_body: A Supreme Court bench hearing the petition over the hijab ban in Karnataka schools and colleges has stated that the High Court had no option but to interpret the Quran. The petitioners had stated that while determining whether hijab was an essential religious practice, the HC's observation was objectionable since the court should not have embarked upon interpreting Quran.

181.title: Helping 2000+ professionals in switching to Data Science career: Scaler
181.article_body:
Scaler's Data Science & Machine Learning with Analytics program is helping 2000+ working professionals to switch their career paths and transition to data science. With a chance to learn hands-on with 80+ business case studies, more working professionals are choosing this online course without quitting jobs, it stated.

For those looking to transition from non-tech backgrounds to data science, the Free Class has been the perfect place to start, stated Scaler.

182.title: 'Taarak Mehta...' actor Shailesh Lodha replaced by Sachin Shroff
182.article_body: Shailesh Lodha, who portrayed Taarak Mehta in television show 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah', has been replaced by Sachin Shroff. The show's producers said, "With Shailesh, we had tried a lot to find a middle ground but he left the show...Viewers can't be kept waiting." Sachin has featured in 'Sinndoor Tere Naam Ka', 'Tumhari Paakhi' and 'Aashram 3' among others.

183.title: I'll be thinking about pulling out of WBBL: Mandhana on workload
183.article_body: India Women vice-captain Smriti Mandhana has said she'll consider pulling out of the upcoming Women's Big Bash League (WBBL) to manage her workload. "Because I don't want to miss out on playing for India," she stated. "Post the one-day World Cup, I have been on the road [with the Sri Lanka tour, the Commonwealth Games, the Women's Hundred]," added Mandhana.

184.title: Wife of Sarabjit Singh, who was killed in Pak jail, dies after falling off 2-wheeler
184.article_body: Sukhpreet Kaur, the wife of Indian national Sarabjit Singh who was killed in Pakistan jail in 2013, passed away on Monday. She was a pillion rider on a two-wheeler when she accidentally fell from it near Fatehpur in Punjab, police said. Her cremation is scheduled to take place at her native place Bhikhiwind in Tarn Taran on Tuesday.

185.title: Pune's BORI to launch online learning platform for Indology courses
185.article_body: Pune-based Bhandarkar Oriental Research Institute (BORI) is going to launch an online learning platform named 'Bharat Vidya', through which courses on Indology will be offered. The platform will include courses on Indic languages, art, culture, science and philosophy.  As many as ten courses on subjects, including the Vedas, Mahabharata and Sanskrit, will be offered initially.

186.title: What security will you give, you should be ashamed: Kejriwal to Guj Police
186.article_body: While talking about security protocols, Aam Aadmi Party chief Arvind Kejriwal told the Gujarat Police that they should be ashamed of themselves. "What security will you give, you have a (black) spot on you," he added. When reminded about security protocol in the state, Kejriwal said, "It is this protocol that has saddened the people of Gujarat...The public is unhappy."

187.title: Bus crashes into driving instructor's shop in Punjab; 12 injured
187.article_body: At least 12 people were injured after a private bus crashed into a roadside shop, which belongs to a driving instructor, in Punjab's Banga on Monday. The bus conductor, who was also injured, told police that the driver was drowsy and wanted to stop. The shop owner said that he had gone for a driving lesson when the incident occurred.

188.title: India's industrial growth slows to 4-month low of 2.4% in July
188.article_body: India's industrial production growth slowed to a four-month low of 2.4% in July from 12.7% in June, official data showed on Monday. This was driven by poor showing by the manufacturing, power and mining sectors, the data further showed. Industrial growth, which is based on the Index of Industrial Production (IIP), had hit a one-year high of 19.6% in May.

189.title: Prince Harry banned from wearing military uniform at Queen vigil
189.article_body: Prince Harry has been banned from wearing military uniform as he mourns the Queen. Only working Royals have been permitted to dress in uniform at five ceremonial occasions. Earlier on Monday, Harry wrote about his special memories of when the Queen attended his passing out parade in 2006 when he became an officer in the British Army.

190.title: 2022 could be the wettest year in Bengaluru's history: IMD
190.article_body: With over 1,590 mm of rain having already been reported this year, 2022 could be the wettest year in the history of Bengaluru, said India Meteorological Department (IMD). The city is likely to surpass the previous high of 1,615 mm of rain recorded in 2017. "The amount of rain this year was unprecedented," said an IMD official.

191.title: UP CM Yogi Adityanath visits Jewar airport site to check work
191.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath visited Noida International Airport site in Jewar on Sunday to check the ongoing work. "Increase the machinery and resources at the airport site to ensure that the project is completed as soon as possible. This airport is extremely important for the overall development of the entire region," the UP CM said.

192.title: What happens to banknotes worth $95 billion in UK with Queen Elizabeth's face?
192.article_body: The Bank of England has said that banknotes and coins bearing Queen Elizabeth's face will continue to be accepted as forms of payment and that the formal declaration regarding the country’s currency will be made seven days after the Queen's funeral. It is estimated that banknotes worth $95 billion and about 29 billion coins are in circulation in the UK.

193.title: Atmosphere of anger, hatred generated by a particular ideology: Rahul
193.article_body: Every single person in this country is Indian and if anybody hates any other Indian then he is hating the idea of India itself, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said on Monday. "Today, we have an atmosphere of anger and hatred generated by a particular ideology," Gandhi added while addressing a gathering in Thiruvananthapuram.

194.title: UP CM reviews debris disposal post Noida twin tower demolition
194.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday reviewed the post-demolition debris management of the Noida twin towers, razed on August 28. "The CM was informed that the waste processing unit has a daily capacity of 350 tonnes to 400 tonnes...However, the unit is now functioning at 700 tonnes a day capacity," the Noida Authority said.

195.title: Hannah Waddingham reveals she is wearing sneakers under gown at Emmys; pic viral
195.article_body: Hannah Waddingham has revealed that she prioritised comfort on the red carpet at Emmy Awards, with the actress choosing sneakers over heels. Speaking about her decision to wear sneakers with her pale pink Dolce & Gabbana gown, Waddingham said, "Do you know what the best thing about things like this is? Nobody knows that I don't have heels on underneath."

196.title: 1 die, 4 injured as shuttering of under-construction building collapses in UP
196.article_body: A labourer was killed and four others were injured after the shuttering of an under-construction forensics institute collapsed in Lucknow's Sarojini Nagar on Monday, police said. Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has constituted a three-member committee to probe into the incident. CM Yogi has also directed the officials to release compensation to the deceased's family.

197.title: Disappointing, painful: Muslim body on court order in Gyanvapi case
197.article_body: The All India Muslim Personal Law Board (AIMPLB) said that the Varanasi district court's order in the Gyanvapi case is very "disappointing" and "painful". "The government should strongly protect the 1991 Worship Act otherwise the minority community will be disappointed...and will feel that all the doors of justice are closed for them," AIMPLB said in a statement.

198.title: BMC to inspect cattle sheds in Mumbai to check lumpy skin disease
198.article_body: In order to check the lumpy skin disease outbreak, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to visit various cattle sheds in Mumbai. The civic body will visit the sheds in teams and issue notices to owners if the sheds are unclean. Further, the BMC will also provide medical treatment to animals found infected with the disease, officials said.

199.title: Iran using military facilities in Syria to produce missiles: Israel
199.article_body: Israeli Defence Minister Benny Gantz has accused Iran of using military facilities in Syria to produce advanced missiles and weapons for its proxies. Iran is also working on building missile and weapons industries in Lebanon and Yemen, Gantz said, adding, "If this trend will not be stopped, within a decade, there'll be advanced Iranian industries across the region...spreading terror."

200.title: Zendaya becomes 1st Black woman to win Emmy for lead actress in drama series twice
200.article_body: Zendaya has become the first Black woman to win the Emmy for lead actress in a drama series twice. In 2020, she became the youngest-ever Emmy winner for the outstanding lead actress in a drama series category. This is the second time she won the award for her role in HBO series 'Euphoria'.

201.title: Got a 1-line idea for 'No Entry 2' in 2016, everyone agreed upon it: Anees
201.article_body: While talking about 'No Entry 2', filmmaker Anees Bazmee said the team came up with a one-line idea in 2016 and everyone agreed on it. "Developing a script around this one-line idea and then writing the dialogues took a lot of time...to make...a film where people don't have to use brains...we have to work our mind a lot," he added.

202.title: Boucher to step down as South Africa head coach after 2022 T20 World Cup
202.article_body: South Africa head coach Mark Boucher will step down from his role after the 2022 T20 World Cup in October-November, Cricket South Africa has announced. Boucher, who became the head coach in December 2019, had been contracted until the end of the 2023 ODI World Cup. Notably, the announcement came hours after SA lost their three-Test series against England 1-2.

203.title: Want to interview Karan Johar, what's this desperation: Kangana on Brahmastra
203.article_body: While talking about Alia Bhatt-Ranbir Kapoor starrer 'Brahmastra', actress Kangana Ranaut said that she wants to interview filmmaker Karan Johar and understand why he is declaring a gross collection of the film and not a net collection. "What is this desperation? Even if we believe them, how come ₹650 crore film emerged a hit already," she wrote on Instagram Stories.

204.title: Farmer gets ₹5.65 crore for giving up 2.05 acres for Pune Ring Road
204.article_body: A farmer from Urse has been given a compensation of ₹5.65 crore for giving up 2.05 acres of land for the Pune Ring Road project by the Maharashtra State Road Development Corporation (MSRDC). "We have given compensation to one farmer on a figurative basis and the final list of compensation is being readied," said an official.

205.title: 350 PMC workers clean manholes after rainfall causes waterlogging
205.article_body: Around 350 workers from the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) were cleaning manholes and stormwater drainage lines at 80 locations in the city on Monday after rainfall caused waterlogging. "We have deployed 25 people in each ward office to expedite the work of clearing choked drainage lines. We finished 80% of work today," PMC Drainage Department head Santosh Tandale said.

206.title: Who won what at the Emmy Awards 2022?
206.article_body: At Emmy Awards 2022, Zendaya and Lee Jung-jae won the awards for the lead actress and actor in drama series for 'Euphoria' and 'Squid Game', respectively. Meanwhile, Jean Smart and Jason Sudeikis won lead actress and actor in comedy series awards for 'Hacks' and 'Ted Lasso', respectively. 'Succession' won outstanding drama series award. 'Ted Lasso' won outstanding comedy series award.

207.title: Court convicts 2 AAP MLAs for rioting, attacking policemen in 2015 case
207.article_body: A Delhi court convicted AAP MLAs Akhilesh Pati Tripathi and Sanjeev Jha for rioting and attacking policemen at Delhi's Burari Police Station in 2015. The quantum of the sentence will be announced on September 21. "The prosecution has been able to prove...accused persons...were part of the unlawful assembly...had provoked the crowd and encouraged them to get violent," the court said.

208.title: Girl walking back home dies after iron gate falls on her in Delhi
208.article_body: A 13-year-old girl, who was walking back home from school, died after an iron gate fell on her and the iron rods on top of it struck her head in Delhi's Khajuri Khas. The girl was taken to a hospital where she was declared dead during treatment. Two other girls, who were walking with the deceased, were not injured.

209.title: No buffalo meat supply in Mumbai from today as govt bans transportation
209.article_body: There will be no supply of buffalo meat in Mumbai as the authorities placed a restriction on cattle transportation due to outbreak of lumpy skin disease, Mumbai Municipal Commissioner said. "We have banned transport of cattle and buffalo from other states to Maharashtra as well as the transport of these animals between districts," state dairy and animal husbandry minister said.

210.title: HCL fires 350 employees globally who were working on Microsoft project: Report
210.article_body: HCL Technologies fired 350 employees globally who were working on its client Microsoft’s news-related products, as per a report. The employees were informed about this during a town hall last week. As per the report, these employees will be offered severance pay and were laid off from geographies including India, Guatemala and the Philippines, among others.

211.title: Probe on Instagram page Jhamunda after operator stalks couples in Hyderabad
211.article_body: A probe has been launched on Instagram page 'Jhamunda' after its operator allegedly stalked couples and uploaded their pictures and videos. Reports said three cases were filed against the page after people noticed their videos uploaded on the page and notified Hyderabad police. "A special team has been constituted to dig into the 'Jhamunda' page and its activities," police said.

212.title: 8 killed in fire at e-bike showroom near Hyderabad, several jump from building
212.article_body: Eight people were killed and several were injured in a major fire that broke out in an e-bike showroom on the ground floor of a building and spread to a hotel located on the first and second floors in Secunderabad. Several people jumped out of their hotel rooms. Telangana Home Minister Mohammed Mahmood Ali said the incident is being probed.

213.title: It took us close to 7 years for VFX: 'Brahmastra' co-producer Namit
213.article_body: Talking about 'Brahmastra', the film's co-producer Namit Malhotra said, "I had a running joke with [director] Ayan Mukerji that after James Cameron, he's the only guy who's taken this long (for a film)." Namit added it took them close to seven years to finish the film's VFX. "We made 'Brahmastra' for half the cost of a Hollywood movie," he stated.

214.title: Activist jailed for 2 years for insulting Thailand's Queen
214.article_body: A Thailand court has sentenced an activist who dressed as Queen Suthida during a protest in 2020 to two years in prison for insulting the monarchy, the activist's lawyer said. Jatuporn Saeoueng, in October 2020, walked a red carpet at a demonstration wearing a pink dress with a fellow protester holding an umbrella while other protesters sat on the ground.

215.title: Blue Origin's uncrewed rocket crashes to Earth a minute after launch, video surfaces
215.article_body: A Blue Origin rocket crashed back to Earth just a minute after it was launched on Monday, marking the first launch failure for the Jeff Bezos-led space travel company. While the uncrewed capsule parachuted back to Earth after its abort system kicked in, the rocket came crashing down. "It appears we've experienced an anomaly...This wasn't planned," the launch commentary announced.

216.title: Majority Twitter shareholders vote in favour of sale to Musk: Report
216.article_body: A majority of Twitter shareholders reportedly voted in favour of the company's $44 billion sale to Tesla CEO Elon Musk. Shareholders were expected to vote in favour after Twitter's stock price went from $54.20 apiece in April to around $41 apiece currently. Twitter and Musk will go to trial in October to resolve his attempt to cancel the acquisition deal.

217.title: 20-yr-old man climbs onto train roof in Mumbai, suffers 80% burns
217.article_body: A 20-year-old man suffered 80% burn injuries after accidentally touching the overhead wire of a parked train at a railway yard in Mumbai on Monday. The victim, identified as Aman Shaikh, works as a loading-unloading agent at a shop in Jogeshwari East. "He had his mobile phone in...hand when he suffered...shock and was possibly taking selfies," an official said.

218.title: Pune records highest number of swine flu cases, deaths in Maha in 2022
218.article_body: Pune has recorded the highest number of swine flu cases at 540 and 36 deaths in Maharashtra in 2022, according to a report. At least 880 persons were swine flu positive since January till date, as per PMC data. As many as 2,992 persons have been infected with swine flu and there have been 147 deaths across Maharashtra this year.

219.title: I wanted to see someone fat like me in the media: Singer Lizzo after her Emmy win
219.article_body: After accepting the Emmy Award for Outstanding Competition Program for her reality series 'Lizzo's Watch Out For The Big Grrrls', singer Lizzo said, "When I was a little girl, all I wanted to see was me in the media. Someone fat like me, Black like me, beautiful like me." "I'm very emotional. The trophy is nice," she further said.

220.title: We put ourselves out there, kudos to us: Neelam on 'Fabulous...' criticism
220.article_body: While talking about the criticism the show 'Fabulous Lives Of Bollywood Wives 2' gets from viewers, actress Neelam Kothari said that she and others attempted something and that it has been successful. "We put ourselves out there and kudos to us...if you make a movie or a serial, you will have lovers and you will have haters," she said.

221.title: Bengaluru reports 218 new COVID-19 cases, 1 death
221.article_body: Bengaluru reported 218 new COVID-19 infections on Monday, taking the cumulative total to 18,68,794 cases, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said. One patient died of the infection, taking the total death toll to 16,984 in the city. The number of active cases was 2,540, while the infection positivity rate stood at 2.21%.

222.title: Arsenal's Europa League match against PSV cancelled due to lack of police
222.article_body: Arsenal's Europa League match against PSV Eindhoven scheduled for Thursday in London has been postponed due to a lack of police resources. The London Police is currently concentrating its resources on Queen Elizabeth II's body lying in state from Wednesday till her funeral on Monday. Arsenal's Premier League match with Brentford on Sunday is also in doubt, claim reports.

223.title: 3 arrested amid movement of Queen Elizabeth's coffin in Edinburgh
223.article_body: Three people were arrested in Edinburgh for allegedly causing disturbances on Sunday and Monday as Queen Elizabeth's coffin was moved around the city, Scottish police informed. A 22-year-old woman and a 74-year-old man were arrested separately on Sunday, Reuters reported, adding that the woman had been pictured holding an anti-monarchy sign. The third arrest was reportedly made on Monday.

224.title: Never really smiled, always serious: Shaquille O'Neal on Kobe Bryant
224.article_body: Retired basketball legend Shaquille O'Neal said his former LA Lakers teammate, late Kobe Bryant, was someone who "never really smiled" and "was always serious". O'Neal also revealed that Bryant followed Michael Jordan "very closely" and adapted most of his mannerisms on and off the court. Both O'Neal and Bryant together won three championships for the LA Lakers.

225.title: Only time in history they don't do the rule: Hamilton on Italian GP
225.article_body: Mercedes F1's Lewis Hamilton said the Italian GP ending behind the safety car was "only one time in the history" that the FIA did not follow the norm. "It always brings memories back. That is the rule that it should be, right?" he said. Hamilton lost the title last year due to a different interpretation of the safety car rule.

226.title: Smriti Irani's family firm, Goa bar owner had lease agreement: Activist
226.article_body: During a hearing, activist Aires Rodrigues showed a lease agreement that was signed between a firm allegedly linked to Union Minister Smriti Irani's family and the owners of Goa's Silly Soul Café and Bar. The restaurant owner's lawyer claimed that the agreement never culminated in a deed. Rodrigues had complained against the alleged illegal renewal of the restaurant's excise license.

227.title: Matches against Spain will be mock test ahead of hockey WC: PR Sreejesh
227.article_body: Indian hockey goalkeeper PR Sreejesh said that the opening two FIH Pro League matches against Spain will be a "mock test" ahead of the next year's hockey World Cup in Bhubaneswar and Rourkela. "It will also help us in providing young players [with] the experience of playing high-level hockey...It will...help us [in] setting the tempo for the WC," Sreejesh said.

228.title: J&K people have no rights, no forum to project grievances: Mehbooba
228.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti said that Jammu and Kashmir is currently at such a crossroads where people do not have any rights, nor do they have a forum to project their grievances. She said that the LG administration is showcasing "phoney achievements". Mufti added that the BJP-run administration is only weaponising the pain of Kashmiri Pandits for political objectives.

229.title: Death toll from earthquake in China reaches 93, search on for 25
229.article_body: The death toll from the magnitude 6.8 earthquake that hit China's Sichuan province last week has risen to 93, authorities said. As many as 25 people remain missing as of Sunday evening, rescuers informed, according to state news channel CCTV. More than 50,000 people were relocated in the immediate aftermath of the earthquake due to damaged buildings.

230.title: Premier League solely responsible for Superleague idea: Ex-Bayern CEO
230.article_body: Former Bayern Munich CEO Karl-Heinz Rummenigge has claimed that it is the Premier League's six richest clubs that were responsible for the controversial European Superleague last year. "The big instigator is solely England. This idea came about because of the income in the Premier League," said Rummenigge. Bayern Munich was the biggest club that refused to participate in the Superleague.

231.title: I'd have probably got Shami instead of Harshal: Kris on India's T20 WC squad
231.article_body: Commenting on India's 15-member squad for upcoming T20 World Cup 2022, ex-chairman of BCCI's selection committee Kris Srikkanth said he would've probably picked pacer Mohammad Shami instead of Harshal Patel. "We're playing in Australia, the guy [Shami] has got the real action...bounce...he can get on early wickets," he added. Shami has been named as a standby for the World Cup.

232.title: Why Marathi Manoos have been thrown out from Mumbai?: CM Shinde to Uddhav
232.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde has "challenged" former CM Uddhav Thackeray to "publish the statistics of how many" Marathi speaking people are "left in Mumbai". "For many years they (Thackeray-led Sena) kept seeking votes in the name of Marathi people. You should answer why the Marathi Manoos have been thrown out from Mumbai to the outskirts like Virar," he said.

233.title: Woman saved while crossing train track risks life again for water bottle in UP
233.article_body: A video has shown a woman being rescued while crossing train tracks in UP and then risking her life again to get her water bottle. An IRTS officer shared the video which showed the woman getting the bottle kept at the edge of the platform, just as the train went by. "Such people should be fined," said a Twitter user.

234.title: Sikandar Raza creates history, becomes 1st player from Zimbabwe to win ICC monthly award
234.article_body: All-rounder Sikandar Raza has created history by becoming the first Zimbabwe player to win the ICC Men's Player of the Month award. Raza beat New Zealand all-rounder Mitchell Santner and England all-rounder Ben Stokes to claim the monthly award for August, with the 36-year-old scoring three ODI centuries during the month alone. "I'm incredibly humbled and honoured," Raza said.

235.title: Messi, Mbappe among highest ranked in FIFA 23 as Ronaldo slips below
235.article_body: Lionel Messi, Karim Benzema, Robert Lewandowski, Kylian Mbappe and Kevin De Bruyne are the highest-ranked players with 91 points in EA Sports' FIFA 23 game. Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo features among the second-highest scorers with 90 points. Liverpool players Mohamed Salah and Virgil van Dijk have also been marked at par with Ronaldo, while PSG's Neymar has 89 points.

236.title: Kejriwal has dinner at Guj auto driver's home after police stops him on way
236.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal on Monday had dinner at the house of an auto-rickshaw driver, who had invited him earlier in the day, in Gujarat's Ahmedabad. Kejriwal was earlier stopped by Gujarat Police from visiting the driver's house, citing security reasons. "We don't want your security...You've held us hostage," Kejriwal said, while arguing with a police officer.

237.title: God save him from the evil eye: Pakistan head coach Saqlain Mushtaq on Babar Azam
237.article_body: Talking about Babar Azam, who scored 68 runs in six Asia Cup 2022 matches, Pakistan head coach Saqlain Mushtaq said, "Anybody with a deep eye of cricket will realise...he's unlucky with the way he's getting out." He added, "The way he plays and his work ethic needs no further discussion. He's a world-class player and God save him from...evil eye."

238.title: Man calls Queen's son Andrew 'sick old man' at funeral procession, arrested; video out
238.article_body: A man was arrested on Monday for heckling Queen Elizabeth's son Prince Andrew during her funeral procession in Scotland's Edinburgh. The incident happened when King Charles and Prince Andrew followed the Queen's coffin that was being brought to St Giles' Cathedral. "Andrew, you're a sick old man," shouted the heckler. Prince Andrew has been accused of sexual assault.

239.title: Pickpockets also join Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in Kerala
239.article_body: While the Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in Kerala drew a crowd of thousands of people, it also drew in pickpockets. A police officer said that pickpocketing incidents were reported in some areas and after examining the CCTV footage, they identified a gang of four people. "Not sure if...they were behind the reported incidents of pickpocketing," the officer said.

240.title: Six-year-old girl raped by 22-year-old man in Ranchi
240.article_body: A six-year-old girl was allegedly raped by a 22-year-old man in Jharkhand's Ranchi district. The accused had allegedly lured the victim with chocolates before committing the crime, police said. "The accused was arrested based on a complaint lodged at Namkum Police Station. The girl has been sent for medical examination," said Ranchi Superintendent of Police (Rural) Naushad Alam.

241.title: Akshay Kumar's hairdresser Milan passes away, actor says 'Still can't believe you left us'
241.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar took to Twitter to condole the demise of his hairdresser Milan Jadhav. Akshay wrote, "You stood out of the crowd with your funky hairstyles and infectious smile. Always ensured not even one hair of mine was out of place." He added, "The life of the set...my hairdresser for more than 15 years...Still can’t believe you’ve left us."

242.title: Dreams do come true: Dinesh Karthik on being included in India's T20 World Cup squad
242.article_body: After being included in India's T20 World Cup 2022 squad, Dinesh Karthik tweeted, "Dreams do come true." The last time Karthik was included in India's T20 World Cup squad was for the 2010 edition. The 37-year-old has played 50 T20Is for India so far, scoring 592 runs at a strike rate of 139.95.

243.title: Salman meets Jain monk Acharya Vijay Hansratnasur during latter's 180 days fast
243.article_body: Salman Khan recently met Jain monk Acharya Vijay Hansratnasur during the latter's 180 days of fasting. According to followers of Acharya, the actor sought blessings from the monk and he also learnt various aspects and rituals of Jainism. Reportedly, the 56-year-old Jain monk ended his 180 days of continuous fasting on Sunday, September 11.

244.title: We played to get result in shortened 3rd Test: Stokes after win over SA
244.article_body: After England won the third Test by nine wickets and clinched the three-match series 2-1 against South Africa, England skipper Ben Stokes said his side's main aim was to get a result after the Test was shortened at The Oval. Play was suspended on Day 2 after Queen Elizabeth II's demise. England's Ollie Robinson was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

245.title: MeitY Startup Hub & Meta collaborate to accelerate XR tech startups
245.article_body: MeitY Startup Hub, an initiative of the Ministry of Electronics and IT, will collaborate with Facebook's parent company, Meta, to accelerate and support XR (Extended Reality) technology startups in India. In a statement, the Ministry said, "This collaboration is part of the government's efforts for skilling in emerging and future technologies." The programme will be launched on September 13.

246.title: SGPC holds protests in Punjab demanding release of Sikh prisoners
246.article_body: The SGPC, India's apex gurdwara body, on Monday staged protests at various places in Punjab, demanding the release of Sikh prisoners who have "completed their sentence". It has called for the release of several Sikh prisoners, including those arrested in connection with terror and separatist activities. SGPC has alleged discrimination against such prisoners with respect to the grant of remission.

247.title: Arti Singh says she lost 5 kg in 18 days, shares transformation video
247.article_body: Former 'Bigg Boss' contestant and actress Arti Singh took to Instagram and shared a transformation video of herself in which she can be seen working out. "18 days. 71.21 kg to 66.84 kg...Not giving up," Arti wrote along with the video. Reacting to the video, actress Rashmi Desai commented, "Proud of you babe." Several fans also reacted to her post.

248.title: Rajamouli was paid ₹10 cr to promote Brahmastra's Telugu version: Reports
248.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli reportedly received ₹10 crore from producer Karan Johar for the promotions of the Telugu version of 'Brahmastra'. The 'RRR' director promoted and presented the film in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana. According to reports, the Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer film has been made on a budget of ₹410 crore.

249.title: Bessemer Venture Partners closes 2 funds at $4.6 bn to back startups
249.article_body: Venture capital firm Bessemer Venture Partners (BVP) has closed $4.6 billion in new capital for two funds, the BVP XII and BVP Forge Fund, to back startups. The BVP XII fund will focus on seed and early-stage investments, while the Forge Fund will focus on growth buyout. BVP claims to have more than $20 billion in Assets Under Management (AUM).

250.title: India's agri-food products export up 30% in first 4 months of FY23
250.article_body: India's overall export of agricultural and processed food products increased by 30% to $9.59 billion in the first four months (April-July) of FY23 compared to the corresponding period of FY 2021-22, DGCI&S data showed. Further, the export of fresh fruits and vegetables registered a 4% growth, while processed fruits and vegetables recorded a 51% growth in the April-July period.

251.title: Used to get around ₹1-1.5 lakh for full film in 80s: Mandakini
251.article_body: Veteran actress Mandakini, who made her debut in 1985, said in an interview that actresses were not "very much in demand" in those days, adding that they were "used only for a few songs and romantic scenes". "When we used to work in films, we used to earn around ₹1-1.5 lakh for the full film," Mandakini further said.

252.title: 6 Syrian refugees found dead on boat reaching Italian port
252.article_body: Six Syrian refugees, including three children, were found dead on a migrant boat that arrived in the Italian port of Pozzallo on Monday, the UNHCR said. "They died of thirst, hunger and severe burns," UNHCR's representative to Italy stated. As per the UN agency, the deceased were among those 26 people who had been on the boat for several days.

253.title: Don't know why Babar was dragging the match: Moin Khan
253.article_body: Former Pakistan cricketer Moin Khan has questioned skipper Babar Azam's captaincy in the Asia Cup final against Sri Lanka. "We (Pakistan) should have attacked with our main bowlers, the fast bowlers. That's what common sense says," Moin said. He added, "I don't know why Babar was dragging the match...I guess he started thinking about the final overs. That's negative thinking."

254.title: Hope to never play another Spaniard in a Grand Slam final: Casper Ruud
254.article_body: Norwegian tennis player Casper Ruud said he hoped he didn't have to play any Spanish player in a Grand Slam final. "They know what they're doing in the Slam finals," said Ruud. The world number two lost to Carlos Alcaraz in the US Open 2022 final and earlier in the year lost the French Open final to Rafael Nadal.

255.title: UP govt demolishes 'illegal' madrasa in Amethi
255.article_body: A madrasa, which was built "illegally" on government land, was demolished in Amethi, Uttar Pradesh. The madrasa was built on grazing land along the Banda-Tanda highway in 2009, Amethi DM Rakesh Kumar Mishra said. A fine of ₹2.24 lakh has been imposed on the building's owner. The madrasa was built with the intention to grab the land, officials said.

256.title: Was called hanger in school for being too skinny: Tejasswi Prakash
256.article_body: Actress Tejasswi Prakash revealed that she was called a "hanger" in her school days as she was too skinny. "When we used to play on our school's playground...people used to tell me 'Keep a ₹5 coin in your pocket or you'll fly away'," she added. The actress, who is also the winner of 'Bigg Boss 15', features in 'Naagin 6'.

257.title: Future is here: Roddick after 19-yr-old Alcaraz's 1st-ever Grand Slam title
257.article_body: Praising 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz following his first-ever Grand Slam win at US Open 2022, Andy Roddick said, "Future is here. What a pleasure it's been to see Alcaraz improve so quickly." He added, "Youngest number one in the history of our game...As mature/nice off the court as he is dynamic on it. Cheers to the first of many majors Carlitos!"

258.title: After Apple, Google plans to make Pixel phones in India: Report
258.article_body: Amid supply disruptions due to COVID-19 restrictions in China, Google is planning to shift some production of Pixel phones to India, a report said. Google has reportedly asked Indian manufacturers to submit bids for the assembly of five lakh-ten lakh units of its Pixel smartphones. Earlier, a report said that Apple is planning to begin manufacturing iPhone 14 in India.

259.title: Asia Cup 2022 ends as a nightmare tournament for Babar, Fakhar: Akhtar
259.article_body: Criticising Pakistan captain Babar Azam and batter Fakhar Zaman, ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said the Asia Cup 2022 "ends a nightmare tournament for Babar as a batter. Same disaster for Fakhar". He added, "This combination is not working. Pakistan has to look into a lot of things." In six matches, Babar and Zaman scored 68 and 96 runs respectively.

260.title: On-field conditions were not up to mark in 1st T20I vs England: Mandhana
260.article_body: Talking about India Women-England Women first T20I, India opener Smriti Mandhana said the on-field conditions in Chester-le-Street were not up to the mark to hold an international match. "As a team, we did have a discussion because we didn't play the brand of cricket that we've been playing for...last two months," she added. India lost the match by nine wickets.

261.title: Why doesn't BJP use agencies to find out who's not Indian?: Baghel on CAA
261.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel said the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) targets the poor and underprivileged and asked why BJP doesn't "use [central] agencies to find out who's not an Indian". "CAA means that I have to prove that I am an Indian...It's not just about the Muslims, Muslims are very smart and have kept all their documents properly," Baghel added.

262.title: TMC to bring resolution in Assembly against 'misuse' of ED, CBI
262.article_body: The Trinamool Congress, led by West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, will bring a resolution in the state Assembly against the "misuse" of central agencies like ED and CBI. "They are being used by the Centre to harass non-BJP governments in various states," Parliamentary Affairs Minister Sobhandeb Chattopadhyay said. He added that Opposition BJP may take part in the discussion.

263.title: Rat's head found in food ordered from restaurant, claims TN family; probe launched
263.article_body: A family in Tamil Nadu's Arani has claimed that they found a 'rat's head' in a beetroot fry parcel delivered by a restaurant on Sunday. The family had ordered 35 parcels of food for their guests who had assembled at their house for a condolence event. After the restaurant denied the allegations, police sent the food for testing.

264.title: Kabir Singh became family film despite being edgy, aggressive: Shahid
264.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor, speaking about his 2019 film 'Kabir Singh', has said that it was "technically" an adult film. "The number of people who have liked it and watched it with their families is unbelievable. Somehow, it made it to the family space despite being edgy and aggressive," he stated. Actress Kiara Advani had featured in the film.

265.title: 4,449 families evicted across Assam under current BJP-led govt's tenure
265.article_body: A total of 4,449 families have been evicted across Assam for alleged encroachment since BJP's Himanta Biswa Sarma was elected as Chief Minister in May 2021. Sarma said the government hasn't carried out any investigation on whether the evicted families were Indian or not. We're not aware if evicted families were homeless people due to erosion, Sarma added.

266.title: Abrdn Plc to sell 43 mn shares in HDFC Life via block deal: Report
266.article_body: Edinburg-based finance and insurance company Abrdn Plc is expected to sell 43 million shares in HDFC Life Insurance Company in the price band of ₹564-578.5 per share, a report quoting sources said. The deal is likely to happen through a block deal. The insurance company is also expected to raise up to $313 million through the sale of the shares.

267.title: Prabhas to burn Ravan's effigy at Delhi's Lav Kush Ramleela this year
267.article_body: Actor Prabhas will burn the effigy of Ravan at the Lav Kush Ramleela in Delhi this year. The festivities will commence on September 26 and will conclude on October 5. "Since Prabhas is already playing role of Lord Rama in 'Adipurush'...who better than him to set...evilness of Raavan on fire this Dussehra," Lav Kush Ramleela committee head Arjun Kumar said.

268.title: Which 6 Indians from last year's T20 WC squad don't feature in T20 WC 2022 squad?
268.article_body: As many as six Indian players, who featured in India's T20 World Cup 2021 squad, are not a part of T20 World Cup 2022 squad. Ravindra Jadeja doesn't feature in the squad as he is recuperating from a knee injury. The other five players are Rahul Chahar, Varun Chakaravarthy, Ishan Kishan, Mohammad Shami and Shardul Thakur.

269.title: Shabana attends 'What's Love...' screening at TIFF, shares pics
269.article_body: Actress Shabana Azmi recently attended the screening of her film 'What's Love Got to Do with It?' at the Toronto International Film Festival (TIFF). She took to Instagram to share a few pictures where she can be seen posing with her co-stars Lily James and Sajal Aly. It is a British romantic comedy directed by Indian director Shekhar Kapur.

270.title: Cong cannot be wished away, have more seats than regional parties: Tejashwi
270.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav said that they "cannot wish away the fact" that Congress' numbers are higher than RJD and other regional parties in the Parliament. "Others (parties) are...limited to their own states," Yadav said. He added, "Their (BJP) strength has already come down after the JD(U)'s departure...If we join hands...then BJP will...stop short of the halfway mark."

271.title: What is the IPL team-wise distribution of India’s T20 World Cup 2022 squad?
271.article_body: India's 15-member squad for T20 World Cup 2022 was announced on Monday. Mumbai Indians and Royal Challengers Bangalore have the joint-highest representation in the squad among IPL teams, with three players each. They're followed by Delhi Capitals, Lucknow Super Giants and Rajasthan Royals, with two players each. One player each from SunRisers Hyderabad, Punjab Kings and Gujarat Titans is included.

272.title: Mom said it's okay if I freeze my eggs or be single mother: Mrunal
272.article_body: Actress Mrunal Thakur, during a conversation with Shriya Pilgaonkar, was asked if she has people in her life who make her aware of her "ticking biological clock". To this, she replied, "There are times when I feel I want to have a baby." Mrunal revealed her mother said it's okay if she freezes her eggs or becomes a single mother.

273.title: 5 aides of Nigerian lawmaker killed in attack on convoy
273.article_body: Five aides of a Nigerian Senator were killed when unidentified gunmen attacked his convoy in Anambra state on Sunday evening, the lawmaker's spokesman said. Senator Ifeanyi Ubah escaped unhurt as he was travelling in a bullet-proof vehicle, the spokesman informed. Separatist group Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) has been previously accused by the government of carrying out such attacks.

274.title: India's Jehan Daruvala wins Formula 2 feature race at Monza, finishes 3rd in sprint race
274.article_body: India's Jehan Daruvala won the Formula 2 feature race at Monza and finished third in the sprint race at the track. "Yesss, P1...A big thanks to the boys and girls @PREMA_Team - the car was rapid and the pit-stop amazing...Feels good to go into the break with a double podium under my belt!" he tweeted.

275.title: We smile knowing you & grandpa are reunited: Harry in 1st statement on Queen's death
275.article_body: Prince Harry on Monday released his first statement on Queen Elizabeth's death and addressed her directly, saying, "Granny...You are already sorely missed, not just by us, but by the world over." He said, "Thank you for your commitment to service...Thank you for your infectious smile. We, too, smile knowing that you and grandpa are reunited now."

276.title: I shouldn't have made Dhaakad: Hansal to user saying 'you gave Kangana a flop'
276.article_body: Hansal Mehta reacted after a Twitter user accused him of giving Kangana Ranaut a flop film after the filmmaker praised 'Brahmastra' on the social media platform. The user wrote, "Shame on you. You gave a flop film to Kangana." To this, he replied, "I shouldn't have made 'Dhaakad'." 'Dhaakad' was directed by Razneesh Ghai and had failed to perform.

277.title: Congress will not weaken itself for Opposition unity: Jairam Ramesh
277.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said Opposition unity for 2024 "doesn't mean weakening" the party. "Our allies should also understand that we will not allow ourselves to be weakened further...A strong Congress is an important pillar of Opposition unity," said Ramesh. He added that the BJP is "rattled" by seeing the support that 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' and Rahul Gandhi are getting.

278.title: Flipkart co-founder Sachin Bansal's Navi Technologies gets SEBI nod for ₹3,350 cr IPO
278.article_body: Flipkart co-founder Sachin Bansal's fintech startup Navi Technologies has received approval from the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) for a ₹3,350 crore Initial Public Offering (IPO). Navi Technologies submitted its draft papers in March 2022. The company reported a profit of ₹71.1 crore in FY21 and incurred losses of ₹206.42 crore in the first nine months of FY22.

279.title: Haridwar hate speech accused Jitendra Tyagi granted bail by SC
279.article_body: Supreme Court on Monday granted bail to Haridwar hate speech accused Jitendra Narayan Tyagi. The court asked him not to make any statement in the media with regard to the pending case. Tyagi, along with Yati Narsinghanand, was accused of hurting religious sentiments after videos of their speeches at Dharma Sansad surfaced on social media.

280.title: Iran says it has developed drone designed to hit Israeli cities
280.article_body: Iran has developed an advanced long-range suicide drone capable of striking Israeli cities, the chief of Iranian ground forces said, as per a semi-official news agency. "We have specially designed this drone for Haifa and Tel Aviv," Brigadier General Kioumars Heidari stated. "We will reveal its capabilities in future drills," he added. The drone has been named 'Arash-2', Heidari informed.

281.title: 10 dead so far after poll candidate distributes hooch in U'khand
281.article_body: Two more persons who fell ill after consuming illicit liquor distributed by a panchayat election candidate in Uttarakhand have died, taking the total number of deaths in the case to 10, police said. Two other persons are currently undergoing treatment. Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami has ordered a magisterial probe into the incident.

282.title: Over 67,000 cattle died since July due to lumpy skin disease: Centre
282.article_body: The Centre said over 67,000 cattle have died since July due to the lumpy skin disease with the 'goat pox' vaccine still being used. "In Rajasthan, the number of death is 600-700 per day...in other states, it is less than 100," said an official. A new 'Lumpi-ProVacInd' vaccine will take three-four months to be commercially available, added the official.

283.title: She kept her promises with dignity: Olivia Colman on Queen Elizabeth II
283.article_body: Actress Olivia Colman, speaking about Queen Elizabeth II's legacy, has said, "She made a promise as a young woman and she absolutely kept it with such dignity." Olivia played Queen Elizabeth II in two seasons of the series 'The Crown'. The actress further said that King Charles III is going to do a good job. Queen passed away on Thursday.

284.title: SL played superb, hard luck for Pak in Asia Cup final: Afghanistan's Gurbaz
284.article_body: Afghanistan opener Rahmanullah Gurbaz took to Twitter following Sri Lanka's Asia Cup win and wrote, "Congratulations to Sri Lanka...They played superb. Hard luck for Pakistan. It was a good tournament for all the teams to prepare for T20 World Cup 2022." Notably, Afghanistan were the only team to defeat Sri Lanka in the tournament. Sri Lanka beat Pakistan in final.

285.title: Air India to get 30 new planes in 1st big expansion since acquisition
285.article_body: Air India has signed agreements for 25 Airbus and five Boeing aircraft which will enter service in late 2022. Marking the airline's first major fleet expansion since its acquisition by the Tata Group, the Boeings will be deployed on existing routes between India and US. The airline will also offer Premium Economy flights for the first time on international flights.

286.title: Govt plans ₹20,000 cr aid to oil firms hit by rising costs: Report
286.article_body: Government is planning to pay around ₹20,000 crore to the state-run fuel retailers to compensate them for losses and keep a check on cooking gas prices, a report quoting people familiar with the matter said. Oil Ministry has reportedly sought a ₹28,000 crore-compensation, but the Finance Ministry is agreeing for only ₹20,000-crore. The talks are reportedly at an advanced stage.

287.title: Conspiracy against me: Punjab minister after 'extortion' audio clip goes viral
287.article_body: An audio clip of a conversation allegedly between Punjab minister Fauja Singh Sarari and his close aide has surfaced online in which the duo can be purportedly heard discussing a plan to extort money from officials and transporters. "The audio clip is fake and is a conspiracy against me," the minister said, while demanding action against those circulating the clip.

288.title: It’s a powerful action drama: Milap Zaveri on his upcoming directorial
288.article_body: Speaking about his upcoming directorial, Milap Zaveri has said that it is a work in progress. "It's a powerful action drama and will go on floors next year," he added. Along with his directorial, Milap revealed, "I'm also writing the story, screenplay and dialogues for Mohit Suri's next." He added, "I'm also penning the screenplay...dialogues for Remo D'Souza's next film."

289.title: Roman Reigns would smash MS Dhoni's numbers on cricket field, says WWE's Paul Heyman
289.article_body: WWE wrestler Roman Reigns' special counsel Paul Heyman took to Instagram Stories to react to a news article which recalled how he had asked ICC for royalties for allegedly paraphrasing his mantra 'Eat. Sleep. Conquer. Repeat' to praise MS Dhoni. He wrote, "For the record...my Tribal Chief...Reigns would smash Dhoni's numbers on the cricket field...and that's something everyone should acknowledge!"

290.title: Police conducts flag march in Ayodhya after Gyanvapi case verdict
290.article_body: Police conducted a flag march in Uttar Pradesh's Ayodhya after the Varanasi district court's verdict on the Gyanvapi case on Monday. The Varanasi court agreed to hear a group of Hindu women's plea seeking access to pray inside the Gyanvapi mosque. The Anjuman Intezamia Masjid Committee had questioned the maintainability of the Hindu side's plea.

291.title: Criminal who escaped from jail caught by villagers in Meghalaya
291.article_body: A day after four of the six undertrial prisoners, who had escaped from a jail in Meghalaya, were lynched by a mob, villagers on Monday caught the fifth criminal and handed him over to the police. The prisoner was allegedly tied up and paraded through the village, as per reports. The sixth prisoner is yet to be apprehended.

292.title: E-auction of 10 commercial coal mines to start tomorrow: Ministry
292.article_body: Coal Ministry has said that e-auction for 10 coal mines will be launched on Tuesday, adding that technical evaluation of bids has been completed, a PIB release said. E-auction for the mines will be conducted on two days, i.e., Tuesday and Wednesday. Total peak rate capacity of the mines being put up for e-auction is 39.31 million tons per annum.

293.title: Event celebrating men's divorce cancelled after protest in MP, pic of invite viral
293.article_body: An event to celebrate the divorce of 18 men, organised by NGO Bhai Welfare Society in MP's Bhopal, has been cancelled following protests. A card inviting people to the event, earlier scheduled to be held on September 18, had gone viral online. The invite mentioned various activities for the event like 'Jaimala Visarjan' and 'Gents Sangeet'.

294.title: Pune auto associations ask RTO to allow charging as per tariff card
294.article_body: The Pune autorickshaw associations have demanded that the RTO authorities allow them to charge customers as per new tariff card rates since the RTO is yet to calibrate some auto meters. The revised rates came into effect in Pune, Pimpri Chinchwad and Baramati from September 1. Of the 94,000 autorickshaws in Pune district, only 30,000 have been calibrated till now.

295.title: I often buy a lot of cheap things, the middle class in me hasn't gone: Rakul
295.article_body: Rakul Preet Singh in an interview said she often buys a lot of cheap things, adding, "I'm quite cheap that way...that middle class in me hasn't gone." She added she doesn't shop "with the price tag". "If I like something I'll pick it up from...normal brand...if I like something on high street I'll pick it up from there," said Rakul.

296.title: Rename new Parliament building after BR Ambedkar: T'gana CM to Centre
296.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao said a resolution will be passed in the state Assembly, urging the Centre to rename the new Parliament building after BR Ambedkar. "(Ambedkar is) among people who made great efforts for welfare of downtrodden," KCR said. Telangana wouldn't have been formed if it weren't for a section that Ambedkar added in the Constitution, he added.

297.title: Amazon India marketplace revenue rises over 30%, net loss narrows
297.article_body: Amazon Seller Services, which runs Amazon India marketplace, recorded over a 30% rise in operational revenue, and its net loss narrowed in FY22 to ₹3,649 crore from ₹4,748 crore in FY21. Last year, Amazon Seller Services reported a 50% rise in revenue. Amazon Pay India, which runs payments services in India, reported a 16% rise in revenue from last year.

298.title: Vikram attends wedding of his house help's son, pics surface
298.article_body: Actor Vikram, who predominantly works in the Tamil film industry, recently attended the wedding of his house help's son at the Thiruporur Kandaswamy Temple in Tamil Nadu. Several pictures of Vikram in a white shirt and mundu have also surfaced online. The actor, known for films like 'I' and 'Anniyan', was recently seen in 'Cobra'.

299.title: Same path as that of Babri Masjid: Owaisi on court order in Gyanvapi case
299.article_body: We're going on the same path as that of the Babri Masjid issue, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said while reacting to Varanasi district court's order in the Gyanvapi case. The court has rejected the plea questioning maintainability of civil suits challenging Gyanvapi mosque's title. After this order, purpose of Places of Worship Act 1991 will fail, Owaisi added.

300.title: Centre mulls additional LPG subsidy of up to ₹30,000 crore: Report
300.article_body: The Centre is considering an additional subsidy of up to ₹30,000 crore to keep the retail price of LPG in check, CNBC TV18 reported. The additional subsidy will reportedly be "over and above" the budget earmarked for the Centre's Ujjwala scheme. The estimated amount is higher than the ₹5,812 crore marked as LPG subsidy in the budget estimate for FY23.

301.title: Noida projected to have 620 electric bikes by December end
301.article_body: By the end of December, 62 docking stations across Noida will be home to a total of 620 electric bicycles. Ten e-bicycles will be available at each station during the pilot programme started by the Noida Authority. The docking stations' locations include Sector 6 Noida Authority office, the Sectors 15, 16 and 18 metro stations and Botanical Garden, among others.

302.title: HC directs filing of PIL over deaths of 2 manual scavengers in Delhi
302.article_body: The Delhi High Court has directed that a Public Interest Litigation (PIL) be filed over the deaths of two manual scavengers in Delhi's Mundka. The court took suo motu cognisance of the deaths that resulted from them inhaling toxic gases inside a sewer while cleaning a drain. A case was registered under section 304A of the Indian Penal Code.

303.title: I don't wanna compare myself to Federer, Nadal, Djokovic: World no. 1 Alcaraz
303.article_body: Spain's 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz said it's "incredible" to be the youngest-ever world number one in men's tennis, but it's much tougher to stay on top for 20 years like the 'Big 3', Roger Federer, Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic. "That's what I'm looking for. I don't wanna compare myself to them, but I wanna be like them," he added.

304.title: Jacqueline issued fresh summon in ₹200-crore money laundering case
304.article_body: Delhi Police's Economic Offences Wing on Monday issued a fresh summon to actress Jacqueline Fernandez to appear before it on September 14 in connection with an alleged ₹200-crore money laundering case. Earlier, she had asked to skip the summons over prior work commitments. ED has named Jacqueline in their chargesheet in money laundering cases that involve conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar.

305.title: 4 farm labourers killed, 5 injured in lightning strikes in Gujarat
305.article_body: Lightning strikes killed four tribal farm labourers and injured at least five others in Gujarat's Surat, Dang and Dediyapada on Sunday. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) had forecasted heavy rainfall in some parts of the state till September 16. In one of the incidents, four people were returning home from the fields in Surat when they were struck by lightning.

306.title: Some things never change: Abhishek on surprising father Big B on set
306.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan took to Instagram and shared a picture of his surprise visit to his father and actor Amitabh Bachchan's set. He also shared an old picture with his father. Along with the picture, Abhishek wrote, "Some things never change...Surprise visits to his set will always be one of my...favourite things to do."

307.title: Bombay HC orders probe against inspector who ensured minor's trial as adult
307.article_body: The Bombay HC has ordered a probe into allegations that a Mumbai Police inspector misled the Juvenile Justice Board to ensure a minor was tried as an adult. The minor, arrested in a murder case, was allegedly targeted as his father could not meet the officer's demand for ₹50,000. The boy had been lodged in the Thane Central Jail.

308.title: Baba Ramdev to launch IPO of 4 firms under Patanjali brand: Report
308.article_body: Yoga guru Baba Ramdev would launch the IPO of four companies under the Patanjali brand, a report said. The companies that'll be listed on the stock market during the next five years include Patanjali Ayurved, Patanjali Wellness, Patanjali Medicine and Patanjali Lifestyle. During an interview, Ramdev said that his company is planning to sell 6% promoters' stake in Patanjali Foods.

309.title: We've rejected Reliance Infra's ₹500-cr arbitration claim: Adani Transmission
309.article_body: Adani Transmission Ltd (ATL) on Monday said Reliance Infrastructure Ltd's ₹500-crore arbitration claim over a dispute under the share purchase agreement (SPA) in December 2021 has been rejected by it. These are afterthoughts and based on untenable positions, ATL said. It added that Reliance Infrastructure hasn't yet settled Adani Electricity Mumbai Ltd's significantly larger claims under the SPA.

310.title: NZ Rugby fined for not having 40% representation of women on board
310.article_body: New Zealand Rugby Chairman Stewart Mitchell has confirmed that the board has been penalised for not meeting Sport New Zealand's requirement for having a 40% representation of women on the board. According to a report, the country's apex body for rugby will lose $172,060 in funding from the government. Currently, three out of nine board members of NZR are female.

311.title: Woman arrested for stealing child from Mumbai to increase income
311.article_body: A 35-year-old Delhi woman was arrested for stealing the child of a Mumbai's Borivali-based couple in order to increase her source of income. Police say the couple had let the woman live with them for three days before she took off with the three-year-old boy. Police arrested the woman when she was trying to board a train from Dadar station.

312.title: Switzerland identifies site for nuclear waste storage facility
312.article_body: Switzerland's nuclear waste authority has identified a site for setting up the country's first permanent nuclear waste storage facility near the German border. The Swiss government, however, will need the parliament's approval before it can sign off on the proposed site. The proposal could also face a possible referendum. Construction of the storage facility is estimated to begin in 2045.

313.title: 4 coaches of passenger train derail in Odisha's Koraput; none hurt
313.article_body: At least four coaches of Visakhapatnam-Kirandul passenger special train derailed in Odisha's Koraput district on Monday, the East Coast Railway (ECoR) said in a statement. No casualties have been reported in the incident so far, officials said. "All passengers managed to get down safely from the train," Divisional Railway Manager Anup Satpathy said.

314.title: Sri Lanka showed true character as a unit to win Asia Cup 2022: Yuvraj
314.article_body: Congratulating Sri Lanka following their Asia Cup 2022 win, Yuvraj Singh said that they deserved to win the tournament. "After losing to Afghanistan in the first game [Sri Lanka] showed true character as a unit to win the tournament...well done skipper," he added. Sri Lanka won five matches in a row after losing to Afghanistan in their first match.

315.title: No reasons for Iran to reject EU's offer on nuclear deal: Germany
315.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Monday said Iran has no reason to reject the proposals by European countries on reviving the 2015 nuclear deal. It is regrettable that there has been no positive response to the proposal by Iran yet, Scholz added. Earlier this month, Iran sent its latest response to the EU's "final text" drafted for the pact's revival.

316.title: Pvt jets not allowed, world leaders to take bus to Queen's funeral in London: Report
316.article_body: World leaders and VIPs arriving in the UK for Queen Elizabeth's funeral have been asked to take commercial flights instead of private jets to transport them, Politico reported, citing a document. The attendees, including US President Joe Biden, can't take helicopters or state cars to the funeral, Politico said. They'll reportedly be taken to London's Westminster Abbey on a bus.

317.title: I feel proud we managed to create great energy at cinemas: Ayan on Brahmastra
317.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmastra' has collected ₹225 crore worldwide within three days of its release, director Ayan Mukerji shared on Monday. "Brahmastra has gotten off to a great start with audiences over its first weekend," Ayan wrote, adding that he feels proud that the team "managed to create a great energy at...cinemas over the last three days".

318.title: Aaditya Thackeray could lose MCA membership for owing ₹7,941 in dues
318.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray and his cousin Varun Sardesai are among the 92 individuals who have defaulted on their annual membership fees of the Mumbai Cricket Association (MCA), Kandivali. The MCA has written to the CEO asking for permission to cancel their memberships. Aaditya has a total outstanding of ₹7,941, while Sardesai's amount is pegged at ₹38,515.

319.title: Bodies of 3 teenage boys found from river after 3-day search in U'khand
319.article_body: The bodies of three boys, who were missing since September 10 in Uttarakhand's Pauri district, were found in a river on Monday. The boys, aged 13,15 and 16, had left their homes to stroll around the Duggada petrol pump area on a two-wheeler. The bodies were pulled out from the river with the help of ropes.

320.title: New sculptures installed in Pune to remain covered till inauguration: PCMC
320.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) installed sculptures across the city as part of a beautification process and they will remain covered till the inauguration, officials said. The project entails beautifying prominent chowks, and a team of artists from across the country was chosen to make sculptures using scrap material. Each sculpture will cost over ₹2 lakh, officials said.

321.title: BBMP begins demolition drive at 2 locations to clear stormwater drains
321.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has started demolition drives at two locations in Bengaluru to clear stormwater drains following floods caused by heavy rains. While one BBMP team began demolitions in Mahadevapura zone, the other team started clearing parts of Ragam megastore in AECS Layout. BBMP Chief Engineer Basavaraj Kabade said, "20 buildings have encroached near Spice Garden Layout."

322.title: Does anyone want me to do it again?: Brie on playing 'Captain Marvel'
322.article_body: Actress Brie Larson, during D23 Expo, was asked how long she would play 'Captain Marvel' in MCU films. To this, she replied, "Does anyone want me to do it again? I...don't know. I don't have the answer to that." Brie first played the role in the 2019 film 'Captain Marvel'. She will next feature as Captain Marvel in 'The Marvels'.

323.title: 5 youths held for performing bike stunts in Chennai after video goes viral
323.article_body: Five bikers have been arrested for allegedly performing stunts on their bikes on Chennai road. A video showing the youths performing the stunts had gone viral. Twitter users had also tagged Chennai police and had called for action against the bikers. While two people were arrested on Saturday, police arrested three more accused on Sunday.

324.title: A weekend full of light: Alia as Brahmastra earns ₹225 cr worldwide in 3 days
324.article_body: As the worldwide box-office collection of 'Brahmastra' crossed ₹225 crore, Alia Bhatt took to Instagram on Monday to share a post thanking her fans. "A weekend full of light and our hearts full of love. So grateful for our audience," she wrote. The film was released in Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Kannada and Malayalam on September 9.

325.title: Divorced man kidnaps girl to raise her as his child in Delhi; held
325.article_body: Delhi Police have rescued a four-year-old girl within 24 hours after she was kidnapped by a divorced man. The accused has been arrested and sent to judicial custody. "[He] is a divorcee and a drunkard. He wanted to raise the girl child as his own...But he got scared and had abandoned her on the way," a senior police official said.

326.title: 240 held for harassing women during Ganesh Chaturthi in Hyderabad
326.article_body: Hyderabad's SHE Team arrested 240 people for allegedly misbehaving with women during the recently concluded festival of Ganesh Chaturthi. The arrested were found to be touching women inappropriately, stalking them, and taking their pictures near Ganesh pandals across the city. SHE Team members were clad in plain clothes and were secretly carrying cameras.

327.title: Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan' sold for ₹125 cr to OTT platform: Report
327.article_body: The 'Ponniyin Selvan' franchise has reportedly been sold for ₹125 crore to an OTT platform. Filmmaker Mani Ratnam is the director of the two-film franchise. The first instalment of 'Ponniyin Selvan' will release on September 30. The film will feature Vikram, Karthi, Trisha Krishnan and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan.

328.title: Pakistan played well in Asia Cup, but not very well: Inzamam
328.article_body: Former Pakistan skipper Inzamam-ul-Haq said that Pakistan played "well" in the recently-concluded Asia Cup tournament, but not "very well". "Many of their (Pakistan) flaws were on show. They could not capitalize on the pressure, which helped them reduce Sri Lanka for 58-5 at one stage of the game," Inzamam said. He added that the Lankan pacers had done their "homework".

329.title: Ethereum blockchain may be upgraded this week to cut energy use by 99.9%: Report
329.article_body: Ethereum blockchain is expected to undergo a software upgrade this week to allow it to consume 99.95% lesser energy than it currently does to create ether tokens, Reuters reported. The Ethereum Foundation said the upgrade, known as 'The Merge', will take place between September 10-20. The upgrade may widen the technology's use and support ether token's price.

330.title: Someone in your office ate your dosa: Cong to Tejasvi Surya
330.article_body: Responding to BJP leader Tejasvi Surya's comment that he didn't receive the parcel of dosas sent by Congress, party leader Tejesh Kumar C said that someone in Surya's office ate his dosas. "It's been more than 24 hours & I still haven't received it. They can't deliver a dosa properly and they dream of delivering good governance!" Surya previously said.

331.title: 40-yr-old man stabs 25-yr-old woman for abusing his mother in Delhi
331.article_body: A 25-year-old woman was allegedly stabbed by her 40-year-old neighbour in Delhi's Sagarpur for abusing his mother, officials said on Monday. The accused was under the influence of alcohol during the altercation, said DCP (southwest) Manoj C said. The accused alleged the woman had abused his mother, which angered him, he said, adding that he used a kitchen knife.

332.title: School bus with students catches fire in Navi Mumbai, no casualty
332.article_body: A school bus carrying students caught fire in Navi Mumbai's Kharghar area on Monday, officials said, adding that no injuries were reported. Four students of a school, a staffer and a driver were present in the vehicle when it caught fire, a fire official said. The fire was doused within 15 minutes, the official added.

333.title: There's wave of happiness: UP Deputy CM as Gyanvapi suit held maintainable
333.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Brajesh Pathak said there is a wave of happiness after the Varanasi district court held that a group of Hindu women's plea seeking access to pray inside the Gyanvapi mosque was maintainable. "I'm receiving many phone calls expressing happiness," Pathak said. The Anjuman Committee had said that the Gyanvapi mosque is a Waqf property.

334.title: Pregnant woman carried on stretcher, delivers baby in forest in Maha
334.article_body: A pregnant tribal woman was carried on a makeshift stretcher due to lack of a proper road in a village in Maharashtra's Palghar district, officials said on Monday. The 21-year-old woman delivered the baby in a dense and dark forest in Maharashtra. A video of the woman being carried by some people surfaced on social media.

335.title: Tyres stolen from 3 cars in Delhi's Greater Kailash, probe on
335.article_body: Thieves in Delhi's Greater Kailash area stole tyres from at least three cars in the early hours of Monday, the police said, adding that the accused took all four tyres of one car. CCTV footage of the incident shows a man getting out of a car around 3 am, quickly removing tyres and then escaping.

336.title: Team India squads for T20I series against Australia and South Africa announced
336.article_body: The BCCI has announced Team India squads for T20I series against Australia and South Africa. Fast bowler Mohammad Shami, who has been named standby player for India's T20 World Cup 2022 squad, features in squads for both series. Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Hardik Pandya have been included in squad for Australia T20Is, while they have been rested for South Africa T20Is.

337.title: Retail inflation rises to 7% in August after falling for 3 straight months
337.article_body: The country’s retail inflation, which is measured by the Consumer Price Index (CPI), rose to 7% in the month of August after falling for three straight months, government data showed. The CPI stood at 6.71% in July, 7.01% in June and 7.04% in May. In April, the CPI had hit an eight-year-high of 7.79%.

338.title: Man stabs 2 brothers over argument about a girl in Delhi, 1 dead
338.article_body: A 20-year-old man was declared dead, while his 21-year-old brother sustained injuries after their friend stabbed them over an argument about a girl in Delhi, officials said on Monday. The accused was in a relationship with the woman in question, said DCP (north) Sagar Singh Kalsi, adding that the victims had passed comments about her a few days back.

339.title: I will feature in season 2 of 'Duranga': Actor Amit Sadh
339.article_body: Actor Amit Sadh has revealed that he will be featuring in the next season of 'Duranga'. "I am happy to see the outpouring of love for my cameo role in Duranga. I have huge admiration for the whole team...especially the cast who have worked so hard to make a complex series," he stated. Gulshan Devaiah featured in the first season.

340.title: UAE court rejects Danish extradition plea for fraud case accused
340.article_body: An Emirati court has ruled that the prime suspect in a $1.7 billion tax fraud case cannot be extradited to Denmark. Sanjay Shah is wanted by Danish authorities for his alleged involvement in one of Denmark's largest-ever fraud cases. The case pertains to an elaborate scheme as part of which ineligible foreign businesses claimed tax refunds from the Danish exchequer.

341.title: Vedanta picks Gujarat for its $20-bn joint venture with Foxconn: Report
341.article_body: Vedanta has picked Gujarat to set up a semiconductor plant under its $20-billion joint venture with Taiwan's Foxconn, Reuters reported. Vedanta reportedly obtained financial and non-financial subsidies, including cheap electricity, from Gujarat to build the semiconductor plants. Vedanta had sought 1,000 acres of land free-of-cost on a 99-year lease while lobbying for incentives with states.

342.title: Muslim petitioners to move HC in Gyanvapi case as Hindu suit held maintainable
342.article_body: After Varanasi district court agreed to hear Hindu women's plea seeking access to pray inside Gyanvapi mosque, Muslim petitioners said they'll move to the High Court. Uttar Pradesh Minority Minister Danish Azad Ansari said the court verdict should be respected. The Anjuman Intezamia Masjid Committee had questioned the maintainability of Hindu side's plea, saying the mosque was a Waqf property.

343.title: Ex-Gazprom unit to pay penalty for failed LNG deliveries to India: Official
343.article_body: A former unit of Russia's Gazprom will pay a penalty for the LNG cargoes it failed to deliver to India since early June, said an official. Under a 20-year contract, Gazprom Marketing and Trading Singapore was to supply 2.5 million tonnes of LNG to GAIL (India) this year and will now pay a penalty of 20% of the agreed price.

344.title: These 2 weeks have been incredible: Alcaraz on 1st Grand Slam win, no. 1 spot
344.article_body: After winning his maiden Grand Slam title at US Open and becoming the youngest men's world number one, 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz tweeted, "These two weeks have been incredible and have included some very tough matches." He added, "Thank you NYC for the support...energy on court is impossible to explain! And thank you everyone on the other side of the world."

345.title: Article 370 will be restored in J&K: Mufti on Azad's can't be restored remark
345.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti on Monday responded to Ghulam Nabi Azad's "Article 370 cannot be restored" remark and said that it was his "personal opinion". "There are voices in J&K who believe Article 370 will be reinstated," she said. Congress is making false promises if they're talking about restoring Article 370, Azad previously said.

346.title: Man allegedly rapes dancer on pretext of taking audition in Gurugram
346.article_body: A man allegedly raped a 37-year-old professional dancer on the pretext of taking a dance audition in Gurugram. The woman alleged that he also filmed the act and had physical relations with her several times. "He threatened to kill me when I resisted...After...long time, I decided to move to police," she added. Police have registered a case into the matter.

347.title: Team India squad for T20 World Cup 2022 announced
