347.article_body: The BCCI today announced the 15-member Team India squad for T20 World Cup 2022. Rohit Sharma will be captaining India in a major ICC tournament for the first time. The squad includes Harshal Patel, who will be featuring in his maiden T20 World Cup. Leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal, who wasn't selected for last year's T20 World Cup, features in the squad.

348.title: Richa Chadha, Ali Fazal to tie the knot on October 6 in Mumbai: Report
348.article_body: Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal are reportedly getting married on October 6 in Mumbai. According to Pinkvilla, the pre-wedding festivities will begin at Delhi Gymkhana Club on September 30 and continue for three days. Mehendi and sangeet ceremony will take place on October 1. Reportedly, a reception will be held on October 7 at a Mumbai hotel for Bollywood celebrities.

349.title: 20 antique idols seized from French national's residence in Tamil Nadu
349.article_body: The Tamil Nadu Idol Wing CID seized 20 idols from the residence of a French national in Auroville city. An attempt to smuggle antique artefacts out of the country was planned before the officials raided the accused's residence. The search was initiated following information about a handicrafts shop illegally dealing in stolen antique artefacts belonging to Tamil Nadu.

350.title: External Affairs Minister signs condolence book for Queen Elizabeth II
350.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar signed the condolence book for Queen Elizabeth II at British High Commissioner to India Alex Ellis's residence on Monday. "She will be long remembered as a friend and well-wisher of India," Jaishankar said. She was the longest-serving monarch of the United Kingdom and the second longest in world history.

351.title: Bank watchman steals guard's ATM card in Pune, escapes with ₹90,000
351.article_body: A watchman employed at Bank of Baroda's Kalewadi branch allegedly stole the ATM card of a 76-year-old security guard and withdrew ₹90,000 without his consent. The victim used to take the accused's help in withdrawing money, for which he shared his card details with him. The accused swiped the card at different ATMs, the investigating officer said.

352.title: Inventor behind Amazon's Alexa raises $20 mn for new AI startup
352.article_body: The inventor of various technologies used by Amazon Inc's Alexa, William Tunstall-Pedoe, has raised $20 million for a new Artificial Intelligence (AI) startup called Unlikely AI. Amadeus Capital Partners, Octopus Ventures and former Google CFO Patrick Pichette, who is currently a Twitter board member, are backing the startup. Tunstall-Pedoe left Amazon in 2016 and was advising AI companies.

353.title: Their ecosystem burnt alive 59 karsevaks in Godhra: Surya on Congress' post
353.article_body: Reacting to Congress' burning khaki shorts post, BJP MP Tejasvi Surya criticised the party and claimed that Congress' ecosystem burnt alive 59 karsevaks in Godhra in 2002. "Congress' fires lit in the past have burnt them in most of India. The remaining embers in Rajasthan and Chhattisgarh will also be reduced to ashes very soon," said Surya.

354.title: $7.75 million payment to whistleblower didn't breach deal with Musk: Twitter
354.article_body: Responding to Tesla CEO Elon Musk, Twitter has said that the $7.75 million payment made to a whistleblower didn't breach any conditions of its $44 billion buyout agreement with Musk. Musk’s lawyers had earlier said that Twitter's failure to seek Musk’s consent for Peiter Zatko's payment violated the merger agreement, thereby stating it as another reason to end the deal.

355.title: $85 mn round fell apart at final moment: CEO of Pak-based startup that shut down
355.article_body: Pakistan-based e-commerce startup Airlift collapsed in July after an $85 million funding round "fell apart at the final moment", CEO Usman Gul told Bloomberg. This was Pakistan's largest-ever funding round at a record valuation of $275 million. A lead investor pulled its commitment, leaving Airlift with no capital to continue and forcing it to abruptly shut down, Gul said.

356.title: BMC introduces 'Bluetooth enabled' stethoscopes in 2 Mumbai hospitals
356.article_body: The BMC, with the help of a start-up, has introduced 'Bluetooth enabled' stethoscopes in two civic-run major hospitals, Sion and BYL Nair Hospitals. The digital stethoscope, AyuSynk, will detect remote auscultation (listening to chest sounds). This will allow doctors to maintain a safe distance in the case of infectious diseases, said Dr Neelam Andrade, the director of major civic hospitals.

357.title: Centre, states trying to control lumpy skin disease in cattle: PM
357.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday said the Centre, along with state governments, is trying hard to control the lumpy skin disease (LSD) in cattle. He noted "there has been a loss of livestock due to the disease across many states in India". Thousands of cattle have reportedly died due to the disease in over eight states, including Gujarat and Haryana.

358.title: TMC MP's relative reaches ED office at 12:30 am after 'typo', pic surfaces
358.article_body: Trinamool Congress MP Abhishek Banerjee's sister-in-law, Maneka Gambhir, reached the Enforcement Directorate office at 12:30 am on Monday. A picture of her standing outside the locked office surfaced online. The central agency called the notice a 'typographical error'. A fresh notice for 12:30 pm was issued, after which she appeared before the agency on Monday afternoon.

359.title: Sanjay Dutt charges ₹10 crore for his next film with Vijay: Report
359.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt is reportedly charging ₹10 crore for an upcoming action thriller film which will also feature Vijay. The 63-year-old actor will be seen in a negative role in the upcoming project, according to the report. The yet-untitled film will reportedly be directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, who also helmed Kamal Haasan-starrer action film 'Vikram'.

360.title: Hostel warden arrested for sexually harassing 7 minor boys in Hyd
360.article_body: A 35-year-old warden was arrested on Sunday in Hyderabad, after as many as seven students alleged that he touched them inappropriately, officials said on Monday. According to reports, the accused forced the students to watch pornographic content on his phone. Furthermore, the accused used to abuse children who slept alone by touching them and sleeping beside them.

361.title: Congratulations for your 1st Grand Slam, no. 1 spot: Nadal to Alcaraz
361.article_body: Rafael Nadal congratulated fellow Spaniard Carlos Alcaraz for his maiden Grand Slam title at US Open and the world number one ranking, saying it's the "culmination of your first great season". Nadal tweeted, "Great effort Casper Ruud...Tough luck today but amazing tournament and season!" The 19-year-old Spaniard beat Norwegian Ruud 6-4, 2-6, 7-6(7-1), 6-3 in the final.

362.title: Had Bhanuka scored at slower pace, his 71 would’ve been of no use: Inzamam
362.article_body: Talking about the importance of strike rate in T20s, ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq said that had Sri Lanka batter Bhanuka Rajapaksa scored at a slower pace against Pakistan in their Asia Cup 2022 final, then their total would've been around 140 runs. "So, [those 71] runs would've been of no use," he added. Bhanuka smashed 71*(45), helping Sri Lanka post 170/6.

363.title: No alliance with any topiwalla: Gujarat BTP leader Vasava
363.article_body: Gujarat's Bharatiya Tribal Party (BTP) founder Chhotubhai Vasava said that his party won't have an association with any topiwalla, be it the ones wearing saffron caps or those donning white caps with a broom symbol. "All parties have ignored the issues of tribals," he added. Notably, BTP has been in an alliance with Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) since May.

364.title: Take back power reforms for the sake of poor people: KCR to Centre
364.article_body: Telangana CM KCR expressed disappointment over the Electricity (Amendment) Bill, 2022 and urged the Centre to take back the reforms. "You made three wrong laws against farmers, you took them back and apologised...So before people raise their voices again, I request you to take back reforms you have introduced for the sake of our poor and SC/ST people," said KCR.

365.title: Ram Temple's construction cost ₹1800 cr, space for seers to be made: Trust
365.article_body: An estimated cost of ₹1,800 crore will be incurred to build the Ram temple in Ayodhya, officials of the trust said. The general secretary of the trust said that the trust has also decided to make space for idols of prominent Hindu seers and the main characters from the Ramayana period in the temple complex.

366.title: Govt may invite EoIs for Container Corp of India's sale in Q3 FY23: Report
366.article_body: Centre may invite expressions of interest (EoIs) for strategic sale of Container Corporation of India (CONCOR) in Q3 FY23, CNBC TV18 reported. The Cabinet had approved the divestment of Centre's 30.8% stake in CONCOR, which is currently owned by Indian Railways, in November 2019. This comes after Indian Railways' land license fees was cut from 6% to 1.5%.

367.title: Adani Realty in advanced talks with DB Realty for merger deal: Report
367.article_body: Adani Realty is in advanced talks with Mumbai-based DB Realty for a merger deal, according to reports. The merger could be one of India's largest real-estate deals. The merger would reportedly aid Adani Realty in becoming a listed firm. Adani is likely to infuse more funds into DB Realty, which would result into a fresh equity issuance to new investors.

368.title: How much prize money did the Asia Cup 2022 winners and runners-up get?
368.article_body: Sri Lanka, who won the Asia Cup for the sixth time, received a total prize money of $150,000. Meanwhile, Pakistan, who finished runners-up at Asia Cup 2022, won a prize money of $75,000. Further, Sri Lanka all-rounder Wanindu Hasaranga, who was named Player of the Asia Cup 2022, received $15,000 for the award.

369.title: I’ve never let his image be heavy on me: Sunny on Dharmendra
369.article_body: Bollywood actor Sunny Deol, son of veteran actor Dharmendra, said he has never let his father's image be heavy on him. Sunny, who made his debut with 'Betaab' in 1983, said he knew he had to pave a path of his own. On the work front, Sunny will be next seen in R Balki's 'Chup: Revenge of the Artist'.

370.title: Woman loses control of scooter, dies after falling in drain in B'luru
370.article_body: A 23-year-old woman died after she lost control of her scooter and fell into a drain in Bengaluru on Sunday. The accident took place at Banaswadi when the woman from Nepal was travelling with a male friend to Hennur at around 12.30 am. She was taken to a hospital where doctors declared her brought dead.

371.title: Missing student's body found with throat slit in West Bengal, friend held
371.article_body: The body of a 19-year-old missing engineering student has been found with the throat slit in West Bengal's Illambazar. The victim went missing on Saturday and his father received a ransom call for ₹30 lakh. The accused, who was friends with the victim, required money and made the latter consume liquor before killing him and making the ransom call.

372.title: Asia Cup win will help T20 WC 2022 preparation: Sri Lanka captain Shanaka
372.article_body: Following Sri Lanka's Asia Cup title, Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka said winning the tournament will help the team's preparation for the T20 World Cup, beginning next month. Sri Lanka beat Pakistan by 23 runs to win their sixth Asia Cup title. Sri Lanka will begin their T20 World Cup campaign with a qualifying match against Namibia on October 16.

373.title: Mumbai taxi, auto drivers to go on indefinite strike from Thursday
373.article_body: Over 48,000 taxi drivers and two lakh autorickshaw drivers in Mumbai, will go on an indefinite strike from September 15, Thursday, seeking a hike in fares, the drivers' union said. "Our demand is to increase the minimum taxi fare to ₹35 from the existing ₹25," said AL Quadros, General Secretary of Mumbai Taximen's Union.

374.title: German minister rejects Ukraine's demands to send main battle tanks
374.article_body: German Defence Minister Christine Lambrecht has again rejected Ukraine's demand to send main battle tanks to support its troops amid the war with Russia. "No country has delivered Western-built infantry fighting vehicles or main battle tanks so far," she said. She added that Germany agrees with its partners that it will not take such action unilaterally.

375.title: Hope to constantly surprise: Kingsley on playing Trevor in 'Wonder Man'
375.article_body: Actor Ben Kingsley, who is reprising his role of Trevor Slattery in the upcoming Marvel Cinematic Universe series 'Wonder Man', said he hopes to "constantly surprise and refresh" as an artiste. The series will focus on the Marvel character Simon Williams, who plays the titular role. Ben had previously played Trevor in 'Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings'.

376.title: Indian players are picking injuries outside field, no one is addressing that: Sehwag
376.article_body: Referring to all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja's injury, Virender Sehwag said Indian players are getting injured outside the field and no one is addressing the issue. "[This] means the things that are happening outside or in the gym need to be addressed," added Sehwag. "Once you're in the Indian team...gym is not as important as skills," he further said.

377.title: India's milk production growth 3-times higher than global average: PM
377.article_body: Addressing the inauguration event of International Dairy Federation World Dairy Summit, PM Narendra Modi said that the country's annual milk production growth is three times higher than the global average. "India produced 146 million tonnes of milk in 2014. It has now increased to 210 million tonnes. That is, an increase of about 44 per cent," he said.

378.title: Guj auto driver invites Kejriwal to dinner, he says 'Will you come to pick me up at hotel?'
378.article_body: An autorickshaw driver, Vikram Dantani, on Monday invited AAP leader Arvind Kejriwal for dinner at his home during AAP's town hall meeting with autorickshaw drivers before state polls. The Delhi CM said, "Will you come to pick me up at my hotel in your autorickshaw?" Kejriwal added he would come to dinner with two other AAP leaders at 8 pm.

379.title: This is new for me: Brendan on receiving award at Toronto Film Festival
379.article_body: Actor Brendan Fraser teared up after receiving the TIFF Tribute award for his performance in 'The Whale'. "This is new for me. I am normally the guy at the podium who hands these things out, I got pretty good at it," he stated. Earlier, Brendan received a standing ovation at the Venice International Film Festival for 'The Whale'.

380.title: Take down picture immediately: Patra on Congress' burning khaki shorts post
380.article_body: BJP leader Sambit Patra criticised Congress MP Rahul Gandhi and asked the party to take down the burning khaki shorts post immediately from social media. "It's not 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' but 'Bharat Todo' and 'Aag Lagao Yatra'...I want to ask Rahul Gandhi if he wants violence in this country. Congress should take down the picture immediately," said Patra.

381.title: B'luru civic body launches Wonder on Wheels for Anganwadi children
381.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) on Monday launched the 'Wonder on Wheels' initiative to introduce art and cultural activities for Anganwadi children in the city. The bus will travel across Bengaluru and stop by Anganwadis. Children will be engaged for one hour in activities related to theatre, music, art and culture.

382.title: Take steps to curb the spread of lumpy skin disease: Shinde to officials
382.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde asked the state's Animal Husbandry Department officials to be on alert and take steps to curb the spread of lumpy skin disease. He also instructed officials to run an awareness campaign to fight the disease. Earlier last week, the government had declared the state as a "controlled area" to curb the spread of the skin disease.

383.title: King Charles exempted from paying inheritance tax on Queen Elizabeth's personal assets
383.article_body: Queen Elizabeth is estimated to have left behind over $500 million in personal assets from her 70 years on the throne. While the bulk of the late Queen's personal wealth will pass to King Charles, he won’t be required to pay any inheritance tax as a rule introduced by the UK government in 1993, exempts sovereign-to-sovereign bequests from inheritance tax.

384.title: Kriti Sanon starts to prepare for Anurag Kashyap's next film: Reports
384.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon has reportedly started preparing for director Anurag Kashyap's upcoming action drama. As per reports, she is undergoing acting workshops and language coaching for the film, which is her first project with Kashyap. "It's an extremely emotional film and the vengeance unleashed by Kriti's character is like never seen before on screen," the reports stated.

385.title: 6 girls escape from hostel in Mumbai by breaking window, locking guard
385.article_body: Six minor girls escaped from the Government Girls Hostel located in Mumbai's Govandi area by allegedly breaking cement window of the toilet and bending the iron grill fixed outside it. The minor girls reportedly locked the gate of the guard's room from outside before fleeing so they don't get followed. The police have been able to identify all the girls.

386.title: 16 women employees faint after spraying of mosquito repellent in Greater Noida firm
386.article_body: At least 16 women employees working in an electronic parts manufacturing company in Greater Noida fell unconscious after a mosquito repellent was sprayed in the company. The management later admitted the unconscious women to a private hospital. The relatives of the women, who reached the hospital, created a ruckus and filed a complaint, accusing the company's management of the incident.

387.title: Haryana women's panel head asks policewoman to get out during meet, video viral
387.article_body: The chairperson of Haryana State Commission for Women, Renu Bhatia, asked a woman police officer to "get out" of a room during a discussion over a marital dispute case, reports said. A video of the incident has gone viral. Bhatia is seen asking the woman police officer, "You could have slapped him (man)...You got the girl checked (medically) thrice."

388.title: No preconditions for mending ties with Saudi Arabia: Iran
388.article_body: Iran has no prerequisites in its talks with Saudi Arabia for normalisation of ties between the two countries, the Iranian Foreign Ministry said on Sunday. "Iran will respond proportionately to any constructive action by Saudi Arabia," the ministry's spokesperson said. Saudi Arabia severed diplomatic relations with Iran in 2016 after a violent mob broke into the Saudi embassy in Tehran.

389.title: Russian and French Presidents hold talks on security at Zaporizhzhia
389.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin and French President Emmanuel Macron held talks over the safety issue at Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant. Putin blamed Ukrainian forces for the shelling while Macron pointed finger at Russian troops. Russia called for a "non-politicised interaction" with UN nuclear watchdog IAEA's participation. France said Russian troops were putting the plant at risk.

390.title: Good toss to lose boys: Jayawardena after SL's win over Pak in Asia Cup final
390.article_body: Ex-Sri Lanka captain Mahela Jayawardena said it was a "good toss to lose" after the Dasun Shanaka-led side defeated Pakistan while batting first in the Asia Cup 2022 final. Prior to the final, Sri Lanka had won matches in the tournament in which they won the toss and fielded first. Sri Lanka defended their 170/6 and won by 23 runs.

391.title: Iran to release 2 seized Greek tankers' crew: Greek seafarers union
391.article_body: The Greek union of commercial ships' seafarers has said that Iran has agreed to release the crew of two Greek tankers that were seized by it in May. Iran had seized the tankers after the US confiscated Iranian oil from a tanker, due to sanctions, held off the Greek coast. The union said that the crew would be replaced.

392.title: Neeraj Kabi to portray Jawaharlal Nehru in Vicky's 'Sam Bahadur': Report
392.article_body: Actor Neeraj Kabi has reportedly been roped in to portray India's first PM Jawaharlal Nehru in 'Sam Bahadur', an upcoming film starring Vicky Kaushal, Sanya Malhotra and Fatima Sana Shaikh. Vicky will play the role of Field Marshal Sam Manekshaw in the movie. While Sanya will essay the role of Manekshaw's wife Silloo, Fatima will portray former PM Indira Gandhi.

393.title: Parts of Pune recorded 60 mm rainfall in 2 hours on Sunday: Report
393.article_body: Pune city witnessed heavy rainfall along with thunder and lightning on Sunday. In less than two hours, many areas in the city, including Wanowrie and Magarpatta, reportedly saw over 60 mm of rainfall. The city reported waterlogging in 25 areas and two incidents of wall collapse from Bavdhan and Warje. Uprooting of 10 trees was also reported in some places.

394.title: Warner is a tactical captain, someone guys love playing under: Finch
394.article_body: Australia T20I captain Aaron Finch has suggested that David Warner could be their next ODI captain. "Warner is an unbelievable tactical captain and someone who at the time the guys loved playing under," stated Finch. Notably, Warner was banned from leadership roles over his involvement in the 2018 sandpaper scandal. "I think (Cricket Australia) is revisiting that," added Finch.

395.title: BJP is worried as public is going to repeat Cong in Rajasthan: CM Gehlot
395.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that "BJP leaders are worried because the mood of the public is to repeat" the Congress government in the state. "There are excellent schemes in Rajasthan including [the] Chiranjeevi health insurance scheme...BJP leaders are working on a theory that if a lie is spoken 100 times, then it will appear as truth," CM Gehlot said.

396.title: No republic plan for New Zealand after Queen's death: PM Ardern
396.article_body: New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern said her government is not considering changing the country to a republic after the death of Queen Elizabeth II. Ardern said she thought New Zealand would probably become a republic during her lifetime but there were more pressing issues. Earlier, Ardern expressed her support for New Zealand to eventually become a republic.

397.title: Sachin Shroff replaces Shailesh Lodha in 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah'
397.article_body: Actor Sachin Shroff has replaced Shailesh Lodha to play the titular role in 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah'. "We had tried a lot to find a middle ground but [Shailesh] left the show...We've a team of good writers and direction...so hopefully people will accept Sachin in the role of Taarak Mehta," the show's producer Asit Kumarr Modi told Aaj Tak.

398.title: Went to washroom, media said I was unhappy: Ajit on leaving during NCP meet
398.article_body: While talking about reports of him leaving the stage during the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) meet in Delhi, party leader Ajit Pawar said that he had just gone to the washroom. "It was presented in the media as if I am unhappy," Pawar said, adding, "Should I give it in writing on a stamp paper that I am not unhappy?"

399.title: I'm super grateful to Ekta Kapoor: Pratik Sehajpal on bagging Naagin 6
399.article_body: Former 'Bigg Boss' contestant Pratik Sehajpal penned a note on Instagram thanking producer Ekta Kapoor for giving him his first-ever television show 'Naagin 6'. Calling himself "an outsider with no industry background", he said that he is "genuinely super grateful" to Ekta. "God bless you infinitely...Thank you for everything!" Pratik further wrote.

400.title: 12-yr-old girl raped in farmhouse near Pune, 22-yr-old man arrested
400.article_body: A 12-year-old girl living in employee quarters at a farmhouse located near Pune was allegedly raped by his 22-year-old neighbour. The man is related to the family of the girl and has been arrested. The girl was alone at her home when the man raped her and threatened to harm her family members if she informed anyone, police said.

401.title: Subject, content of Akshay Kumar's recent films were wrong: Theatre owner
401.article_body: Manoj Desai, executive director of Gaiety Galaxy and Maratha Mandir Cinema, opened up about actor Akshay Kumar's recent films failing at the box office. "Content galat, subject galat (Wrong content, wrong subject)," Desai stated. He added that people were not satisfied with the content of 'Raksha Bandhan'. Akshay's 'Prithviraj', 'Bachchhan Paandey' and 'Raksha Bandhan' failed to perform this year.
